name: vakeshia ellison
text: This place is BS. I had a surgery scheduled and had to cancel due to the flu. They are quick to get your money but will come up with EVERY excuse for a reason to not give you your money back upon giving reasonable documentation. I wouldn't recommend this place to a dog.

resp.text:
We’re sorry she feels this way. We always review the cancellation policy with everyone. One you schedule everything is completely refundable up unless you cancel with less then two weeks notice as we have already by this time committed to all the anesthesia and OR personnel and have to pay them for your surgery that was scheduled. So a small percentage is retained if cancellation is with to short of a notice as we are charged from those professionals for scheduling them. Even with that being said if someone cancelled because of illness even if it is the day of surgery typically that money is left on the account to be applied to their surgery in the future. We do everything we can to help patients as well as try to make the cost of surgery affordable to everyone.

Dr Hedden

name: Just Jashon
text: Had a saline BA done with Dr.Hedden on 3-7-16 and my experience was very pleasant! His facility is very immaculate and clean,his staff,including nurses and people involved with surgery are very kind and have great bedside manner. He's a top notch surgeon with great results. I won't ever go anywhere else for my PS needs. Highly recommend!

name: Crystal Barnett
text: Dr. Hedden did my BA April of 2016 I had it done through my belly button I had a few problems going into the surgery as far as my breast was not symmetrical as well as they were tubular in shape so he wanted me to have realistic expectations I would not have the perfect breast that I wanted but let me just say I believe he was impressed with how beautiful they actually turned out I still like a little bit on the final results I ended up having to wear a shoelace cast for like 6 weeks after the surgery because of my folds being off quite a bit due to my breast not being symmetrical to start with I hated that thing it wasn't very comfortable at all but I can honestly say this it works and  if you do exactly what he tells you to do during the recovery process and stick to it no matter how uncomfortable it is to wear the shoelace cast  you will achieve great results!!! Dr. Hedden is the best and very skilled at what he does!!!!!

name: Belinda Carroll
text: First off I'd like to say I'm very Happy with my surgery and Dr. Schaffer. He did a wonderful job. I'm not happy with his office staff. They often don't return messages. It's like the right hand doesn't know what the left is doing. You can call today ask a question, you don't get a call back so you wait a couple of days and call, a different person looks at your message and it's not what you asked at the start. If you want a good plastic surgeon he's your guy. If you expect good communication with staff, not so good.

name: Erica Cleveland
text: One of the worst experiences I've ever had with a medical professional . Dr.Hedden at my consult seemed nice enough it was a bit of a wait but he apologized for it no biggie or so I thought . I must admit that they do tell you that you probably won't go back immediately you will have some wait. Well I was coming from out of town my surgery was to be at 9:30 am I didn't get called back until 12:20. I had asked what was taking so long as I was paying for a caretaker by the hour and hadn't eaten the night before, I asked the Dr. personally about it he said sorry but sometimes in surgery things happen it shouldn't be much longer he seemed to get agitated but still professional offered me a refund I stated no since I had waited over 3 hours by this time please proceed as soon as possible. While another hour and 30 minutes go by with me in this thin bathroom no nurse or anything comes to check on me I put my clothes back on and ask the lady at the front how much longer she states she didn't know and she went and found someone. By this time I go back to my room then comes in Patrick who was very nice and was going to start my IV, they called him out of the room then comes in Nurse Manager Win (Nguyen ). She states how can we make you happy I'm like at this point just get my arm surgery started and I'm happy I told her I was fine I just wanted to get it over with since I have come all this way. She states I dont think we can make you happy you're going to give the practice a "bad review" I said I am about the lack of communication but I can't say anything about surgery. I was like I'm over it I just want to get my arm lift done so I can go home. She basically said they didn't want to do it because I complained about the wait time. Who or what person taught these people business etiquette I wasn't loud I just stated that I would be giving a review to let people know how they treat their patients. I stated again I'm fine she extended a discount on cool sculpting I accepted I thought everything was fine. Dr. Hedden comes in very very nasty and stated we're not doing your surgery and we're giving you a full refund and I told him I was fine I wasn't happy but not angry enough not to have my surgery after I have waited over 5 hours he storms out wouldn't hear it. They didn't give me a on refund on my travel or hotel, informed the spa not to do my cool sculpting, and also would not honor a gift certificate that I was given. I wasn't all smiles and giggles, but I didn't get loud or curse. The staff couldn't believe it and said they had never heard of such. Please don't go there Dr. Hedden is a bully and don't dare ask to question why you are waiting or you too could be out of money and time beware stay away awful !!!!

resp.text: We always try to do everything to accommodate patient's. What happened in this case which she is not disclosing is that she requested a late arrival time. She was told in doing that she could not be given an exact start time but that she would be following other cases. She expressed that she was upset about the wait when she first arrived. Our office manager offered her and her care giver a free spa service for the inconvenience. She seemed to be happy at that point. When she was brought back I explained we were sorry for any delay but that when someone ask for a delayed start time that it becomes more dependent on the cases before them which are not something that can be predicted. She then explained she was upset that she was paying for a sitter she hired and was having to pay her. I explained we would pay for the sitters time for her delay. Again she seemed happy with that. She then told the nurse that she also wanted some other procedures for free or she would write a bad review if she was not given them. She had voiced this to several staff members. I then went back into the room and told her I did not feel comfortable operating on someone who was blackmailing the practice in an attempt to get procedures for free. That this was not the right way to start a doctor patient relationship and that we would offer her a full refund and cover her sitter for any inconvenience but that I could not proceed now that threats were made in an attempt to get more free services when we had already tried to do so much for her. She then went up to the spa and asked for monetary exchange for the free spa services we had just given her. We always do everything we can to help our patients and do whatever we can to make their experience as nice as possible but this was not our fault. There is a reason we are one of the busiest practices in the country and it's because we do great work and take care of our patients. We treat everyone as if they were family. But a doctor can not operate on someone when the physician patient relationship breaks down as it did here with her attempts to blackmail the practice.

name: Collin Cool

name: MysteryPlayer12
text: Dr. Hedden is the BEST surgeon in the US. He does a great job on surgeries and is very kind. You can go to him for any plastic surgery!!! I cut my leg going up an escalator and he put some kind of glue in it and it got better in the next week!!!

text: The facility was really nice and the staff was amazing. I'd recommend anyone to Dr. Hedden. I had an breast augmentation done and I love it! He really listened to what I wanted and offered great advice.

text: Dr. Hedden is the best surgeon around! He is kind, polite, and honest. He runs a very professional clinic and the staff are extremely nice as well. It's a beautiful office that makes u feel at home.

name: Courtney Hastings
text: I absolutely loved my experience at Dr Hedden’s office!! All the staff is very friendly and Dr Hedden was very nice and helped calm me down right before my surgery. So far I’m absolutely in love with my results and can not wait until I’m completely healed:)

name: Glenda Tippett
text: If I could give a 0 I would. I had the plastic surgery from hell with Dr Hedden. I would NEVER recommend him for anything. They were 5 hours behind the day I got my surgery. I went almost two days without food or water. When I went back to have the IV put in, because I was so dehydrated it took two different people to stick me about 12 times. Finally got back and they stuck me in the supply closet/room where all the implants was. I was like what the heck. I should have walked out. I told the anesthesia to please give me something for nausea before they woke me up, due to I will start thowing up. I woke up in a wheelchair, at my car, 8pm at night, throw up bowl and throwing my guts up. The anesthesia basically said okay to my husband and took the wheelchair and took off. I felt like I had been hit by a train. I thought I was truly going to die that night.  I was sick and hurt for days. When I went back I was so extremely disappointed in my upper and lower eye lift. Dr Hedden was like, oh well that’s all I can do. Long story short, breast augmentation drop huge in 2 years, I had them removed by another surgeon. The other surgeon also told me Dr Hedden did not remove the fatty tissue in my lower eyelid, so that’s why I still had sagging. I was also told Dr Hedden’s office was known for breast implants in and out, in and out. Trust me, you get what you pay for.  Go to a better surgeon!!! That was a waste and two years to pay off $7,000.00.

resp.text: We have searched through our system and there is no patient by this name. I personally checked every Glenda as well as the one and only Tippett but who has a different first name. I looked at all of those patients charts to see if anyone may have had the surgery this person talks about and no one did. So she most likely has us confused with another practice. I’m going to respond to this review though just to give some clarification on our practice and how this could not have happened. First of all no one is ever asked or told to go without food or water for more than 6 hours before their scheduled surgery time. That’s just no safe. Second this person states she was put in a closet. Not really sure what practice could really look like that but ours obviously does not. Anyone reading this can simply take the virtual tour which shows our operating rooms and see that we are probably the nicest surgery center in Alabama and with cardiac size operating rooms. So I really believe she has us confused with another practice. We do all types of cosmetic surgery and are world renowned for all types of cosmetic breast surgery as well. But for the last 15 years I have always charged the same price. I just think that’s doing right by the Patient by trying to make plastic surgery more affordable. But what she put as what she paid is nowhere closed to what we charge for the procedures she states she had. We always remove fat when lid surgery is performed but some fat has to remain around the orbit to cushion and protect the eye. We also have some of the best anesthesia staff in the city and always give patients nausea medication and never have someone leave before their wide awake and able to take care of themselves. Anesthesia does not wheel them to their car. Our recovery nurses help them outside. Lastly I give my cell number to every single patient that comes through our office if someone has a problem I would hope they would actually call the number. I give out my number because I truly do care about all of our patients that’s why I even still make house calls if needed.

name: Diana Martinez
text: Definitely recommend Dr. Hedden to anyone wanting to have cosmetic surgery done. Very pleased with my results. He was very helpful and informative throughout the whole process.

name: Makayla Whitlock
text: I was very nervous at first about getting any kind of plastic surgery done but Dr. Hedden made me feel comfortable and so did his staff. I am very pleased with my results and my experience. I would highly recommend Dr. Hedden to anyone!

He really made me comfortable, and that's saying a whole lot. The staff is very friendly. I've read a few reviews stating that the staff was unfriendly, etc. I've never had anything else but amazing service. From everyone. If I ever have anything else done, this will be the only place I go

name: shaana pope
text: Dr. Hedden is amazing, compotent, and skilled at what he does....this was my very first surgery I have ever had, and his staff made sure that everything was taken care of....by the way I get compliments from everyone

name: Ashley Price
text: I had a breast augmentation done on 4-12-19 and im already in LOVE with them. All of the ladies in the office were so nice and made me feel comfortable and dr. Gunn did such an amazing job !!!!! Went from an A cup to a 36DD and they are perfect😍😍😍

name: Jasmine Billups
text: Although my scar looks great my stomach has never been flat after the surgery ...... it down better than it was..... but after research I would have had better results if I had muscle repair........I was told that it was still swollen..... after a couple of years I guess it's still swollen because my results are the same...... it looks better but not flat....

resp.text: I am sorry you are unhappy with your results. We did perform muscle repair. As much as could be performed. Tummy tucks do not treat fatty tissue in and around the intestines or the thickness of fatty tissue to the upper abdomen. We do the best possible for our patients given the anatomy. That is what was done in this case as well. Remember the best tummy tucks are always when we are at the smallest size we can get to prior to surgery. I think it would do you well to come back in and see what can be done for you.

name: Dionne Jones-Holley
text: I am 2 1/2 months post breast reduction surgery. I had a very specific size in mind prior to my consultation. Dr. Schaffer was upfront and honest with me from day one. He let me know what he was able to do without jeopardizing my health. He is very personable and professional.  For this, I'm thankful. There is no callback or wait from the nurses who are very knowledgeable; you speak to someone as soon as you call. The receptionist and insurance/billing staff are kind as well. I love my results and I am also almost pain free in my back and shoulder areas. Thank you Dr. Schaffer!

name: Ashley Nelson
text: They did an amazing job!!

name: Donna Knoke Cobb
text:
From reception to nurses to Dr. Gunn and anesthesiologist, you cannot find a better place for your surgical needs. Its easy to see that the entire staff loves what they do for patients and loved ones.
Unlike so many surgeons, no question goes unanswered. Their attention to detail is amazing and having had at least fifteen non- plastic surgeries and procedures, gave me comfort that I made the right choice.
No matter your needs, there is no better choice than Dr. Gunn and the wonderful staff at HPS!
Donna C.

name: Heather Layton
text: Amazing results & the friendliest staff!

name: Kaci williams
text:

name: S B
text:
Dr. Hedden placed my implants wrong, causing muscle flex deformity and lateral malposition. I have contacted his office serveral times to discuss the issues and was brushed off. I will now be seeking a malprimalpr lawsuit, as the implants have caused more and more pain over the years and made my job as an exotic dancer impossible to perform. I can not even look in the mirror without crying and I suffer a lot of pain. I would not recommend this man to anyone. He acts like he is the best doctor until you have an issues .my deformity issues showed as soon as the swelling was down and I was informed that this was his mistake. I am also suffering CC due to him placing textureed implants when this was not what I was asked for at all. His resolution to this issue was to just remove the inplants he placed, leaving me with scars and saggy breasts. I plan to gather all of the women I have found in online support groups that he has wronged.
Edit*** I am most definitely one of your patients and have the serial numbers on a card to prove that you used a textured Sientra implant on me. When I confronted Dr. Hedden about this and the double bubble within weeks after surgery, he told me that he would remove my implants and not offer any money back or to replace the implants. I wore all support recommended and didn't try to go back to dancing until years after surgery, which I can also prove. I also have records from a plastic surgeon that I saw in Georgia within months after my surgery, who informed me that a doctor should not have used the implants used, neither texture nor size, neither of which Dr. Hedden spoke to me about before or after surgery. All he did waswbrush me off. I have been suffering since surgery and plan to sue if something is not done to make this right, and especially since you are now denying the use of textured implants. Also, I don't have my full name on this site and use a nickname for my own safety.

resp.text:
We tried to find this patient in our system but no one comes up with her name or anything close to it. We also do not use textured implants as the carry a risk of patients developing a form of cancer. So I’m not sure if this is a patient of ours or even a true patient.  But I will try to respond to her issues. We do perform close to a thousand implants each year and do have several patients who are also dancers. I always try to stress this to dancers ..that you must wear very good support during the healing process and reframe from dancing for the first 3-4 weeks. Otherwise your pocket is not healed enough to prevent migration of the implant down and to the side which is the direction the muscle wants to push it. Patients that come in with no droopiness and wanting a good small implant do not have their muscle changed and so most of the time the implant will not shift much. Also going above the muscle would typically not lead to this but patients would be at higher risk for rippling and capsular contracture (CC). But if someone wants either a very large implant or they have severe droopiness then it will lead to some of the inferior pectoral muscle having to be detached to allow the larger implant to fit or the droopiness to be camouflaged. Thus running the risk of lateral drift if the muscles are used too soon such as an exotic dancer going back to work right away and or not wearing support. So it is very important to always follow the guidelines from your surgeon to minimize any risk of complications. We always offer bliss insurance which would cover any cost of fixing any issues as well. So I’m not sure she is a true patient or our patient because she would have most likely obtained this.
Addendum; she called our office yesterday and is using a different name here but she is very mistaken she does not have textured implants. My nurse called the implant company and gave the serial number to them as well. This is not the appropriate placed to discuss these issues as she should come back in and see us but she wishes to slander us and make accusations that are completely wrong. When someone comes in with droopiness , one breast lower than the other and their breast drifting to the sides because of their chest wall you have a few options all of which are always offered to patients. Asymmetry and droopiness.. best treated with a lift with implants ( cost twice as much and leaves scar that not all patients want ) or biplaner breast augmentation ( less cost , less , scaring but carries the risk of feeling the implant at the bottom and slight double bubble) or going above the muscle (requires silicone, higher risk of capsular contracture). If she really wants this to be educational for you she would consent to her pictures being shown which will show where she started and where she was 3 months out and let everyone judge for themselves. Now it’s very easy to seek a second opinion and a doctor not that busy to say ( without even seeing your before pictures) that something was done wrong. You must understand not all doctors offer all options and some have no experience with biplaner approaches. They will be quick to say something was done wrong so they can charge you to be reoperated on. Always be careful of the doctor giving an opinion without seeing your before pictures. Again this is not the best way to discuss your concerns.

name: Kristen Tanner
text: Dr. LaBarbera is absolutely incredible.  He performed an augmentation (350cc Saline) and lift on me. I went in to his office begging to "be put back to where I used to be" before having two children. He listened to me, took the time to show me pictures, and ask what I was comfortable with. The entire time before, during, and after the surgery he made me feel so comfortable. He was always a text or phone call away if I had the slightest bit of worry about my operation. I just finished my two month appointment and I could not be more amazed! I look exactly like I used to before having kids. I cried at my before and after pictures because it's like the man read my mind!! I had to take my two year old and one year old with me to my last appointment because I couldn't find anyone to keep them and he even took the time to play around with them and make them feel comfortable as well. He even held my one year old while I was getting dressed. Dr. LaBarbera is nothing short of amazing. If you're looking for an awesome plastic surgeon who ginuenly cares about your well being and will give you exactly what you've dreamed of he's your guy! I couldn't sing his praises enough!

text:
I am very disappointed about my smart lipo result done at Heden Plastic surgery one month ago. My back look exactly how it was before the surgery. It is norm and sensitive. I went in for a follow-up up yesterday. Dr. Gunn who did my surgery told me that how it looked now would be how the final result would be. I took a picture of my back today. I wish I know how to post it here so people can see it. It's a waste of money and time, a painful lesson.
This is my 6 months updates: i see a little improvement but overall my back is still fat. I still see rolls along my back as it was. I have not gained or lose any weight. I guess I was not a good candidate for this procedure and wished doctors ar Heden let me know the truth and gave me a better option than just did the smart lipo which cost me almost six thousand dollars and a lot of pain

name: Lindsey Pope
text: My experience with Dr. Hedden was the best! I had a breast augmentation in July of 2012 and it was okay. I did 290cc of saline I can't say anything bad about that surgeon. I just wanted an upgrade I wanted them bigger and I wanted silicone! I had a friend that went to dr. Hedden and she was very pleased with him, so I decided I scheduled a consultation with him it took me about 2 months to get a consultation. I was in the office for probably 15 mins before I was called into a room to see dr. Hedden! Me and my boyfriend played around with the samples while we waited to see what size we liked. I was kinda hard for me to tell what it would look like since I already had implants. Originally I was wanting to go to a 450! But me and my boyfriend continued to talk about it and said we really couldn't even tell a difference so we picked 500 (he wanted me to go a lot bigger being a male of course) but I researched and researched females my size and 500 cc of silicone gel, and I truly liked the size and I felt those would look best! My consultation was July the 14th and that day we scheduled the surgery for august the 10th. My surgery was scheduled for 8 I got back in the room about 9 around 10 the took me back for surgery. I remember waking up around 12:15 and I left at 12:30, I ended up getting 525cc silicone gel! It was a super easy process. I felt like everything was done in a timely manor. I stayed the night the night of my surgery and had to follow up post op day one, while I was there I got some juvaderm injections in my lips! It was pretty painful but I have to say I absolutely love them! They a beautiful I've received so many compliments on my lips! I'm now post op day 5 I can pretty much do anything I'm still a little sore! I will return to work Friday and I can't wait to show off my lips! I highly recommend dr. Hedden and his facility. He truly listens to you and your concerns. He puts his patients first. The staff is awesome as well, they make you feel at home. And the anesthesiologist was great to! The day after I got home I had a get well soon card from his facility which was super kind. If I could do it all over again I wouldn't change one thing! In my opinion Dr. hedden in the BEST plastic surgery!

name: Charmonika Smith
text: I went in for a consultation for a breast reduction and my information was never submitted to my insurance company. the only thing I recorded after I left there was a bill in the mail.

resp.text: I'm sorry you are upset with our practice. When patient's present for evaluation for breast reductions information is only sent to the insurance company if the patient anatomy meets the criteria based on our exam and measurements. I know sometimes the insurance company will tell the patient all they need is a letter stating its necessary and then it will be covered. But that is not the case, they require the doctor to make sure it meets the requirements or they will not approve it. We always try to explain this to every patient so they understand the process. I am sorry she felt we let her down. I think it would be worse to get your hopes up that it would be covered when we know from experience it will not based on your anatomy.

name: Ultreya
text: Lovely new facility, with a great setting beside the sculpture park greenspace on one side. Waaay better overall than the previous location for Family Medicine clinics on Lafayette Street. Patient room, however, was tiny in comparison, not good for ADA compliance EXCEPT they have the new MODERN EXAM TABLES that you can sit on and then it turns into a table when needed! Been waiting 25 years to see these. Customer service needs the same upgrade. Also, reserved parking for people with disabilities was unavailable (not enough) on one visit, and had to park on curb at 2nd floor entrance. On another visit, there were open was one open space. So even though there may be the required 1 per 25, if you have a clinic that serves a high ratio of people with medical conditions that require use of reserved parking, then you need to provide more than what is required by law. It is crazy  to move to a new facility, and still not have enough parking. Either need to add more spaces, offer valet parking or post security outside to give people direction and permission to park safely elsewhere.

name: Jamie McKeough
text: We have struggled and struggled with getting a diagnosis for my 6 year old daughter, and fought against Pediatricians and GP’s blowing off her symptoms. By the grace of God, we finally got a referral to Dr. Gremse. This man has the kindest heart, the most dedication, and the most determination to help a child than any other doctor we have ever met! The entire staff at this office goes above and beyond to make sure every question is answered, and that all of our fears are addressed. He goes WAY out of his way to actually help these children, not just pass out medicines to get a paycheck. I can’t thank God enough for placing Dr. Gremse and his entire office staff in our lives! If you can’t get help for your child, fight with everything you have to get a referral to this man!! He is definitely an answer to our prayers!

name: Kelly J
text:
I had surgery with Dr Marc Zelickson several years ago when he was at a previous practice, and it was a great experience. When I found out on 8/15/2020 that I would need my gallbladder removed, I called his office and scheduled an appointment for 8/20/2020. When I started running a fever and having chills on 8/16/2020 (which is one of the things the hospital ER nurse practitioner warned me to seek care for if it happened) my primary physician started me on antibiotics and recommended that I contact Dr Zelickson’s office and leave a message for his nurse so that they could hopefully see me sooner.

Instead, his nurse asked me “why I thought it was my gallbladder anyway” and (mistakenly) informed me that gallbladder issues don’t cause fevers. She said she would have to ask if they could still see me in the office at all because of this. Never mind that my primary physician’s office understood that there is a possibility of infection, and never mind that the ER physician and nurse practitioner both understood this as well. This nurse didn’t believe it was an issue. She acted like I had no idea what I was talking about and had just decided all on my own that I needed my gallbladder removed.

I immediately contacted another surgeon’s office. Nobody there had a problem understanding what was going on- the nurses didn’t , the surgeon didn’t, and the receptionist didn’t. She had me come in that very same afternoon (yesterday, 8/18/2020) and my wonderful new general surgeon recognized the issue at hand. He removed my gallbladder this morning (8-19-2020) and it was necrotic and covered in pus. THAT is what was causing my fever, and THAT is how a knowledgeable office handles this.

Dr Zelickson and his nurse were flat-out wrong. His nurse called me later yesterday (after I had already called and spoke to receptionist about why I was canceling my appointment) because they needed to reschedule me due to my temperature. Thank goodness I found a surgeon with qualified nurses who actually know how to recognize an infection. I couldn’t eat and could barely drink from 8/15/2020 on. I made Dr Zelickson’s office aware of this also when I made my initial appointment. I really liked Dr Zelickson and his staff when he was at the previous practice but this one is absolutely terrible. They had no problem ignoring my symptoms and apparently believe signs of infection aren’t a thing.

Also, even though I called and canceled my appointment for tomorrow (8/20/2020), and then told the nurse I was canceling my appointment and going elsewhere, I’ve still gotten reminder calls so I have to call yet again I suppose and make sure they know I’m not coming because I wouldn’t put it past them at this point to try and bill me for a missed appointment.

text:
The doctor we see is wonderful. But this is the poorest run Dr. Office we go to. My aged Mother has had cancer and has heart problems so we see several Doctors. This office will tell us that they will contact us when it is closer to time for the next visit. This visit is due in Feb. and it is now Feb. I have called for an apt. I have not heard back. She is now running out of her medication and again I have called for it but have not gotten a call back. In the past I have had to call several times with no return calls. I would just expect that a office connected to Huntsville Hospital would be better run. The last time after several calls I finally went in and parked myself in their office until I could get confirmation that her medication would be called in. It took over an hour of waiting.  Another thing I have had problems with in the past was getting in when my Mother felt her heart was again out of rhythm. I know they are busy but you hate to go to the hospital to find out if she is in trouble. This Heart center has people that run a heart Cardiogram every time we go in so why can't they have a room set up for people that just need to make sure they are ok if they feel they are having problem? Most people would rather have a Doctor visit bill as apposed to a hospital bill just to get a Cardiogram run. There are a lot of people out there that can't afford the hospital bill, but with insurance could get to the Doctor.
Again we love the Doctor we see but feel the heart center needs better management.

name: Lana Dempsey
text:
The Heart Center was a life saving experience for our dad. He received treatment for over 5 years from St. Thomas hospital in Nashville & we never saw positive results. Numerous times we asked why a certain treatment wasn't used and were given bogus answers. Dad's first visit to the Heart Center & being under the care of Dr. Cash was truly a blessing. Dr. Cash immediately identified dad's need to have a pacemaker. Surgery was scheduled, completed, and sucessful. Sadly, several years after receiving his pacemaker dad was diagnosed with Stage IV metastasized lung cancer. Dad had issues of panic/anxiety attacks which were originally thought to have been heart related. After visits and test with Dr. Cash, he diagnosed him with anxiety attacks, just from the shear stress of being a cancer patient. Dr. Cash went above and beyond to care and treat our dad. He prayed with our family and was genuinely concerned for dad as well as our family. We are very grateful to Dr. Cash and his office.
We HIGHLY recommend The Heart Center.

She's done everything she could these last 3 months to avoid taking medications and, she was hoping these test results would reflect that. However THERE WERE NO TESTS done by Dr Valtos! This blows my mind. We just wasted money for him to tell her what she already knew? Not to mention the way he treated her was ridiculous. He didn't believe anything she told him. name: cheryl strickland
text: Huntsville Hospital is a FOR PROFIT, PRIVATELY OWNED hospital who has to answer to stock holders. Therefore their profit margin is much more important than patient care and treatment.  Some of their policies reflect that also. For instance, if you go to the ER needing surgery, if there is not a DR. to do that surgery on duty, you will have to wait until one is scheduled if it "probably" won't kill you to wait.  My husband waited 3 days for an orthopedic surgeon for a spiral break in his femur, which is a very dangerous bone to break. It's where our blood supply is made and when broken, releases air bubbles and clots into the blood stream so he was kept on blood thinners for 3 days before major surgery.  Now, not only did the hospital get to charge us for those 3 extra days and all his normal medications, because you are NOT allowed to take your own from home, but they did NOT have to pay a surgeon overtime or vacation pay to come in when off duty, so we are cash cows to that hospital.  The nurses are horribly underpaid and badly treated, but with Huntsville Hosp. owning all hospitals for 8 counties, they really don't have a lot of choices. Most of the nurses were wonderful, however the Dr.'s, especially Dr. Wright, made us feel like our health was secondary to profit, pushing hard for procedures we are very hesitant about and offering no real evidence they would even help. In fact he told us straight out that it probably would not help, but it just might.  Just be aware the Dr.'s are Huntsville Hospitals life blood money and do your research, ask lots of questions, ask about safety and recalls for any hardware they want to implant. In our case the Defibrillator manufacturer was being sued in a class action suit because the leads were corroding and impaling the arteries, but they were still using these defibs and when we asked about them Dr. Wright's answer was, and I quote "they all have problems". Now that's not exactly comforting.  We told him we wanted to do some research and think about it, but that did not stop his office from calling us EVERYDAY for 3 weeks until I asked them not to call us ever again, we would call them if we changed our minds. Then we were told it was their job to "recruit 12 to 18 surgeries PER DAY".  Yes after 35 years of marriage, it is an "us" decision.  We both feel very uncomfortable with it all. We are going for a second opinion at Vanderbilt. I'll update and post what they tell us.

name: Sky Queen Ce
text: Jeanna in Scheduling needs a different departments other answering the phones. I called for help several times and she just sends me on a run around. To the last time I told her that I really needed help about getting my appointment schedule. She sends me to a dead end then I can't call back cuz it's after 5. Of course all this is because she just want to go home. Started this process today at 2 p.m. I call back at 4:30 only to get basically get the run around for 30 mins and hung up on.  Please pull the tapes. February 6th 2018. Not happy.

resp.text: We'd like to offer our apologizes that you didn't get the help you were seeking. If you need further assistance or would like to speak with someone about your experience our Customer Service Representative is available at (256) 801-6682 or customerservice@theheartcenter.md.

name: Jim Gordon
text: The Heart Center (THC) is responsible for some of the highest-quality medical care I've ever had.  From the scheduling, to the support staff, to the physicians, their care and professionalism have been uniformly excellent.  A few years ago, after experiencing "the bends" on a scuba trip to the Caribbean, I was tested at THC the day after returning to Huntsville.  After an ultrasound test, I was diagnosed with a "patent foramen ovale", or a hole in my heart.  Within a few days, surgery was scheduled, the hole was repaired, and I was home, feeling great.  I've had several other tests at THC, including a very successful cardiac catheterization.  I would heartily recommend THC to anyone who has, or suspects any cardiac issues.

Hi Jim,
Thank you so much for sharing your experience. We appreciate your kind words.

name: Lindsey Frost
text: I was told that I would have to wait 2 and a half weeks for an appointment for a pulse that was above 120 for 2 days straight and horrible chest pains. I had called at noon and was told I just needed to wait and got called back at 4:56 and was told there was nothing they could do cause they were about to close. They said they would call me the next day, 5 days later still have not heard anything. I found another cardiologist at another facility that worked me in immediately given my symptoms and age. I got my meds changed and got a heart monitor. I was more than disappointed in the staff at The Heart Center, and will tell everyone I know. I was only given attitude when I stressed how important this was, like they could care less if I had a heart attack or not. And when I said I may just have to go back to the hospital they said "well then you just do that then", which needless to say did not help my pulse rate problem at all.

name: Kathy Sanders
text:
My Mother is a patience at the heart center and to date it has been a very unpleasant experience.  I am sure that the doctors there are great at their job.  I think Mother has had ok care.
After several calls and no return calls back, we have managed to get the job done.  My Mother was in the hospital in January and ended up on a ventilator, the day she was released from the hospital the heart center was to come down and review her medication.  Never showed, but we had an appointment with her Doctor in a week so thought all would be good, but that appointment was changed, and then changed again.  Yesterday she went into see the dr and he had no idea what meds she was taking and what milligrams, are you kidding me, your nurse practitioner never showed up to review medications.  She is on coreg which needs to be taken two times a day, but the orders said one.  They changed her meds to hydralazine along with the coreg, the hydralazine is to be taken three times a day, but again the orders said once a day. Yesterday they took her blood pressure in the office and said it was 120/70, and my sister said that is strange. It has been running high, and she snapped back well not today.  Then the dr took it and it was 200/94, really.  On the way home from work last night my sister stopped to pick up meds and only one was there, a water pill, not the increased dosage of coreg or hydralazine.  Either this office is very incompetent or they have way to many patience.  Our Mother is very precious to us, and she has been through hell and back.  She deserves better treatment than this .

Dr. Owen is the pro of all pros. He made the process so stress free and was extremely thorough with the details. I was SO nervous  because never been in a hospital for any reason except to visit so this was all very new.. BUT I would do this all over again. I really couldn’t have asked for anything better. I’m EXTREMELY HAPPY  with my results. And if I decide to have anything else done, I know exactly who to call.
Thank you Dr.Owen and Olivia! You guys are absolutely awesome!

name: Olivia Woodham
text: Dr. Owens did an amazing job with my procedure. Natural look, very thorough, and made sure I was taken care from the first consult to my last check up! Highly recommend this office for any plastic surgery needs in the Dothan area.

name: norma
text:
Dr. Feagin and his team are great!  I highly recommend him if you’re considering breast reduction surgery.  I must say I was nervous about having the surgery but Dr. Feagin’s professionalism and compassion quickly put me at ease.  I had many questions, and he never hurried me through them.  He is such a kind, patient and understanding physician!

I decided to see Dr. Feagin because I’ve suffered with chronic neck and shoulder
pain for several years which has only worsened with age.  I’m in my 50’s now (!post-menopausal!) and really wanted relief!!  He assured me this would help -WHICH IT DID!  And as a bonus, my insurance helped take care of it.

A couple of months out from surgery and feeling great!  This is certainly a procedure I wish I had done years ago. Thanks Dr. Feagin, Hilary and Flowers Hospital Surgery Team!

name: Theresa Moulton
text: Dr. Owens is a very professional meticulous doctor,he takes great pride in doing excellent work. He preformed a breast lift and lower face lift on me , and I can tell you I am enjoying my beautiful more youthful face and breasts. Thank you so much Dr. Owens!

resp.text: Thank you so much for entrusting Dr. Owens with your surgery!  He really is meticulous and a true artist.

name: Madie Ard
text: Dr. Feagin and his staff made me feel as comfortable as possible. He did an amazing job with my procedure and has made sure I've done well post-op. The people are so kind, and I highly recommend booking an appointment with him!

name: Alyssa Davis
text: Dr Feagin and his staff is truly amazing. Dr Feagin has a wonderful bedside manner. I am very pleased with my results. I came to him in June wanting breast augmentation and had surgery in July 2020.  I was very self conscious with my breast, and I was very asymmetrical. I am now 2 months post surgery and I love my results and feel confident in my own skin! I highly recommend Dr Feagin!

name: JEFF WILLIAMS
text: Dr . Feagin performed an upper eyelid bleph on me. Same day procedure and I’ve had zero pain, even on the day of surgery. Even though he removed a lot of tissue, I’ve had very little redness and just a little swelling. I couldn’t be happier with the results, even better than expected. His staff, especially Yvette, were true professionals. I highly recommend Dr. Feagin for amazing results.

name: Laura White
text: Dr Feagin nearly killed me. He did a breast reconstruction on me after a double mastectomy. The result looked awful.  I kept getting fluid on my abdomen and had to go to the office to get it drained. I developed MRSA and spent a week in the hospital. Then the implant on the left dropped into my abdomen. I tried to tell Dr Feagin my implant was missing but he said it was impossible. He sent me in for a X-ray to place a drain. They found the implant in my abdomen. I developed MRSA again. I spent Christmas in the hospital. I had to go to wound care and IV therapy for weeks.  Dr Feagin was cold and uncaring and acted like it was my fault.  He also did breast surgery on my sister.  She developed MRSA and had to be hospitalized. Stay away from this doctor. He is dangerous.

resp.text: Ms. White, we have pulled your medical file and reviewed your surgery with us back in 2005.  We are unsure why you haven’t contacted us to discuss any ongoing concerns or dissatisfaction from your results.  We are always available to discuss any patient needs - give us a call at 334-793-7211

name: Katrell Cowart
text: The bedside manners was excellent. It was encouraging the staff was amazing and very helpful. Would recommend  service. Explained the procedure well and you knew what was going on before and after. Very happy with the results although I'm still healing, the process was worth it. Dr. Feagin was great.

name: Kaitlyn Taylor
text:
Dr. Owen was so professional and made me feel comfortable talking to him about any questions I had. I am a 23-year-old 150lb female whose breast was a 32 J and he took me down to a c/d (I haven't been professionally measured). I have absolutely no complaints, and I even kept sensation in one breast! My scars are barely noticeable (I was worried) and he gave me the perfect size for my body type with NO BACK PAIN. My fingers used to go numb from the weight of my breast, and that hasn't happened since before the surgery. I would absolutely recommend Dr. Owen to any person wanting any procedure, but especially to anyone wanting or needing a breast reduction.

I had 3 appointments before the surgery to answer any questions or concerns as well as 3 post-surgery to keep up with my recovery. He did an Anchor incision. His staff  was also the absolute best, one woman even prayed over me when I was freaking out. I genuinely could not have had a better experience.

name: Jennifer Martin
text: I have to say this was a truly amazing experience from start to finish. I have never had surgery in my life and this was better than I ever expected. There were no complications, no scaring, and most importantly no pain what so ever after my surgery. I was back to work 2 days after. Dr. Feagin is the best plastic surgeon in the region for a reason. You have absolutely nothing to be concerned about and you are in very good hands.  Listen to all instructions he gives for before and after surgery. I'm so incredibly happy, thank you so much Dr. Feagin!!!

name: Brandy Hammond
text: My first surgical experience ever was amazing. Dr. Feagin is phenomenal his staff is amazing. I’m 6weeks post op and from start to finish I had no complications, no pain, I had no need for the pain medication that was prescribed, I had surgery on a Wednesday afternoon was back at work Friday morning. I went in with a list of questions and before I could ask he answered literally every one. I highly recommend Dr. Feagin my BA scar is minimal, he gave me exactly what I asked for fuller and natural. I’m very pleased. Do follow all his instructions from start to finish and I guarantee you will be just as happy with the outcome.

name: Lakesha Snell
text: I went in for a consultation for a breast reduction with Dr. Feagin in June. I was approved the same day and set a July surgery date. It is three months out from surgery and can say it was the best decision I ever made. My backaches and headaches are gone and I no longer have numbness in my hands. The staff is wonderful!! They addressed any of my concerns and were supportive the whole way. It is a ROUGH surgery but you will feel so much better in the end. He removed 4lbs from each breast it made a huge difference😊

name: Shelia Hughes
text: Dr. Owen was amazing.  Never rushed, always answered the phone, if I had questions or issues they always seen me quickly, I never had to wait long sometimes I never had to even sit in waiting room at all.  His work is incredible I was nervous about it but it looks amazing and I’m only two weeks out and scarring already doesn’t even look bad.  I highly highly recommend.

name: katrina arnaud
text: From the very first phone call I had an awesum interaction with the staff of dr. owen and the hospitality only got better as we planned this life changing decision. I would recommend dr owen and his staff to anyone i know first class treatment and also the nurses at flowers outpatient surgery they were on top of there game and made me feel so comfotable

name: Jenny Reeves
text: At my first meeting with Dr. Owen and his staff, I felt very comfortable. Dr. Owen is straight forward, professional and caring. Every question I had was answered professionally and advice was given as well. My surgery and follow-up visits were all met with the same care and concern as the initial consultation.  I would highly recommend Dr. Owen, I am very pleased with the outcome! THANK YOU!

name: Karen Raines
text: Dr. Owen is wonderful and does amazing work!

name: Audrey Straub
text: Dr.Feagin did an amazing job. Everyone in this office was extremely kind. They took great care of me. I feel like this surgery changed my life.

name: Tammy Pfalzgraff
text: Dr. Owen and staff are amazing.  From the very first visit for a consult I felt this was the surgeon for me!  He answered every question in depth, covered all aspects of the procedure and was honest about results and recovery.  I never felt rushed.  Staff is wonderful...friendly, warm and inviting.  Surgical team at Flowers were top notch.  I cannot say enough good things about Dr. Owen, staff and surgery at Flowers.  This is a very personal decision for you to make and I know I made the right decision for me. Excellent all the way around!

name: Joni Phelps
text: From day one of my consultation, I knew Dr. Owen was the one, the Best possible Surgeon for me.  He is kind, honest, professional, and most of all he genuinely cares about his patients and their outcomes, they are not just another surgery for him.  When he makes a promise to follow you through to the end of your journey, he means it, no matter how long and hard that journey may be.  There just is no amount of praise good enough that I could say to describe Dr. Owen and his wonderful staff!  Thank you from the bottom of my heart!!!!

name: Dawn Barley
text: I used Dr Owen. This is one hateful man. You do what he wants and better not complain. I had a tummy tuck by him and he cut two deep grooves in my hips and swears it is my waist. You can’t argue and say, “No, you put two deep grooves in my hips and I can’t wear any pants or shorts because they fall to this groove in my hips. By the way they are also crooked. One groove is higher than the other. I’m shaped like a man and it’s like being two different people. I hate what he done to me and I’m not the only one. Met a woman on another site that hates what he done to her too!!!

name: Elizabeth Johnson
text: Wonderful experience with Dr. Owen and staff.  I have had two different cosmetic procedures with him over the years and am very pleased with the results.  I would highly recommend him to anyone!

name: Lora Wood
text: I first would like to say Dr. Owen and staff are the best.  In the beginning of my journey I went for a consultation to a plastic surgeon in Panama City, Florida and I must say it was the most uncomfortable appointment I had ever been to.  They would not even try to get my insurance approved for a breast reduction that I desperately needed for medical reasons.  About a year later I ended up at my Neurosurgeons office in Dothan, Alabama and he highly recommended Dr. Owen.  At my first visit I was very comfortable.  The office worked diligently at getting my insurance approved.  The insurance was a success and so was my surgery.  I am now about 3 months out and everything went great and I feel so much better!  Thank you to Dr. Owen and his great staff!

name: Georgia Catron
text: I would like to thank Dr. Owen for doing such an amazing job on my daughter breast reduction surgery!!! The result where so much better than we expected or envisioned. Dr. Owen and his team were extremely professional. Dr. Owen looked after her every step of the way keeping us well informed during her pre and post appointments. Dr. Owen was very caring, respectful, and also informative. Every time we went in for follow ups we never felt rushed, our questions were always answered to our satisfaction and most of all Dr. Owen was always reassuring and his staff always treated us with respect and never made her feel uncomfortable.  My daughter lived all of her teenage years being uncomfortable and in pain in her neck and back because of her large breasts. She was very insecure about her breast. She hated wearing swimsuits and certain clothes because of the way her breast looked. Now, She is more confident in her walk and she feel so much better overall! She loves the way her t-shirts and tanks fit.  Now she can look in the mirror and feeling great about herself! I would definitely recommend Dr. Owen at Feagin and Owen Cosmetic Plastic Surgery Center!!!!

name: Amanda Watson
text: Dr.Feagin did a great job!  I went from completely flat with hardly any breast tissue and he gave me a wonderful natural looking B that fits my body perfect!  I can now wear clothes and tank tops with confidence!  I especially am enjoying being able to wear a bikini.  The staff is great and friendly!  I recommend them to everyone!

name: Diana
text: Dr. Feagin and his staff are the absolute best! They all made me feel completly comfortable and answered any question I had. From consultation, surgery, aftercare and all in between they were caring and supportive. I discussed with Dr. Feagin what I wanted done and what I wanted to look like. I put my trust completely in his hands, and I am so glad I did! His work is amazing and I am very happy with my surgery.

name: Jessica Thompson
text: Dr. Feagin helped me transform my body after losing 130 lbs. I had the full belt tummy tuck, brachioplasty and fat grafts to the buttocks. I'm still amazed at my results. Feel free to contact me personally for photos. I also have a private group of all my procedures from Day 1. You truly have to see it to believe it. He does amazing work. From the first consult, rolling into the OR and all my follow ups, him and his team have been so supportive. I can't thank you all enough.

name: Nassandra Corbitt
text: I actually went to a cosmetic surgeon in Enterprise, Alabama last year. The surgeon in Enterprise botched my tummy tuck up. The best description of my abdomen would be the work of a Kindergartner playing a game of operation...... My stomach was a mess. I went to Dr. Feagin earlier this year and my tummy is absolutely beautiful! He is a certified plastic surgeon and he really did care about my well being. Dr. Feagin was so compassionate towards me and took his time to explain the procedure to me. His staff is amazing and I cannot express my gratitude to Dr. Feagin. He is the best choice!

name: Serene Jacobs
text: I have had to have 2 surgeries with Dr. Feagin. Each time he has gone above and beyond to make me feel comfortable, make sure I understand what he will be doing for my surgery, as well as made sure I knew how to take care of myself during recover. His office staff is so friendly and helpful. I highly recommend Dr. Feagin and his staff for whatever your needs may be.

name: Lisa Mitchell
text: Since having my breast reduction, I have noticed a huge decrease in neck and upper back strain and pain. I still have some trouble with my right shoulder, but most of that is contributed to my career. I feel much better about myself when I look at pictures and in the mirror. Such a simple decision has helped me to become more active and has built my confidence back, like it used to be. I wish more women would consider this surgery..I wish I had done it a few years earlier. My daughter had the same surgery a couple years before me, and I watched a wonderful transformation with her whole demeanor. It made her feel pretty again..all women deserve that!

name: Rhema Rock
text:
May 19, 2019

I am 1000% satisfied with my Breast reduction/augmentation results‼️

Dr. Feagin was my surgeon and I was referred to him by my sister-in-law. I am 49 years old and I have suffered from neck, shoulder and back pain for years. I didn’t realize it was coming from my 34DDD/36DD breast. I wore very good support bras. But I still got indentions on my shoulders from my bra trying to hold up all that weight 🤣. Dr. Feagin removed “1 pound” from EACH of my breast (which is equivalent to 4 sticks of butter). So I can honestly say that I should have had this procedure done YEARS ago. I am 2 weeks and 5 days post op, a size 36C and my breast look amazing.
I haven’t had any neck, shoulder or back pain so I would recommend anyone that’s having the issues that I was having to consult with Dr. Feagin.
He’s the best‼️

name: Lisa Good
text: I’m 44 years old and have recently underwent breast reduction surgery. I have always had very large breast for my frame and felt very subconscious about them. I have also dealt with shoulder indentions and shoulder and neck and back pain from the weight of them along with other struggles from them being to large and heavy. I finally got up the nerve to go to a consultation to see about a breast reduction. I went to see Dr Feagin and immediately knew that he was the right Dr for me! He was very reassuring that I would not be disappointed and that the pain afterward was minimal. I had my surgery on October 3, 2018. I had to have a Nipple graft because of the size and weight of my breasts. I spent the night in the hospital and went home the next day. The recovery process went amazingly well and pain was minimal. I went from a 38E to a 38D and could not be happier with the results! I would recommend Dr Feagin to anyone!

name: carly adams
text: My whole experience I have been highly satisfied, not knowing anything about my procedure they fulfilled me with all information possible needed as well as made me feel welcome and certain that this is what I wanted done etc etc. Dr. Feagin is a wonderful doctor he made sure that not only he was happy with my decision but I would be as well , and after the procedure was done , I will still smiling ,yes I had some questions I was unsure of or curious about however the girls upfront had that all undercover, taking out of there day to personal message me via socaial media as well as email picture to the doctor because I live 2 hours from the office !! Very helpful :) .. even with living little ways away , they make it manageable with scheduling time and paying for the procedure .. I don’t recommend people pay 5 grand more for the same procedure .THEY are AWESOME !! I have recommended several people to this facility and recommend many more make the same decision .

name: Emily Doss
text: Dr Owens is a hateful Dr. He has a BAD  bedside manner. He acts like it’s an inconvenience to be your Dr. Very disappointed.

name: Lenise23
text: I'm a 49 year old women. I have had many surgeries in the past. I was so scared to have another surgery at my age. I got married in March 2018 and i felt  undesirable and self conscience of my "fupa" so i decided in September 2018 to have Belt abdominoplasty(tummy tuck) and a breast reduction 46DD to 36C. Dr Feagin was GREAT. He did an AWESOME  job. I'm very pleased with my new body. The pain was well worth it!!!

name: D T
text: After my child's birth, breast feeding really took a tole on my upper body and I was self conscious of my breasts every since. Dr Feagin was able to lift and reshape them to look more natural rather than droopy without the use of implants! Surgery went well and he was considerate of my opinions and wishes. I healed very fast (complete recovery within 4-6 weeks) after the bilateral breast mastopexy was performed, no sign of infection and was able to return to work within 2-3 days with lifting precautions in place. I am planning to return for an additional procedure within the next 6 months!

name: Steve Kendrick
text: We would highly recommend Dr. William I. Owen of Feagin and Owen. Our son had broken his nose in a sports injury. We took him to see Dr. Owen on a recommendation from a doctor friend.   Dr. Owen was very professional and thoughtful. He truly cared about our son and the process. He did not immediately rush into surgery but suggested we wait several months for the swelling to go down.  He was flexible by working the surgery around our son’s school schedule since he is an out-of-state college student. Dr. Owen explained everything to us, what he would do during the surgery, what we should expect for the first seven days and then after the follow-up visit; it was spot on.  This made us feel at ease because Dr. Owen had done it so many times before, we knew we could trust him.  Dr. Owen is an excellent doctor and we would recommend him for any procedures you may need.

name: carly shiver
text: Dr. Owen is incredible and his staff are so kind. I couldn't ask for a better doctor! From the first consultation to surgery day and post treatment he has been wonderful. He will forever be my go to plastic surgeon.

name: Tina Albritton
text: I had breast reduction in December 2018 with Dr. Feagin and it was the absolute best decision I ever made! I was a 38DDD before surgery and about a 38C post surgery. I was reluctant at first because everyone told me it was painful,  it would leave me with weird shaped breast, etc... that is soo far from the truth.  I have noticed that my neck and back pain is much better, and I love the shape/size of my new breast. Dr. Feagin and his staff are wonderful and treated me very well! I would do it all over again because it is literally a huge weight lifted off my chest!

name: Tara Holcomb
text: I had such an amazing experience with Dr. Feagin and the staff of Feagin and Owen Plastic surgery. Turned out better than i could have ever imagined. They were extremely professional and so kind. Thank you so much!

name: Rachel Nelson
text: Dr. Feagin and his staff are awesome!!!   I tell everyone that Dr. Feagin is a miracle worker.    One of my implants had leaked/deflated after 14 years;  after a nearly 3 year wait, I was finally able to get my implants replaced.   One implant was encapsulated and the breast tissue was very scarred due to me waiting so long to have them redone. I was extremely nervous about the results I would get.    There was no need to worry; Dr. Feagin is my plastic surgeon.   My satisfaction and results are through the roof.   Dr. Feagin does his work in such a way that people are not sure if I have had work done at all.   That's the sign of an extremely talented plastic surgeon!!!

name: Skylah Woodham
text: I highly reccomend Feagin and Owen! They did exactly what I asked them to do! I have never felt better about myself! Well worth every penny! Thank you so much!

name: Stephanie “Steph” Truitt
text: I never imagined that getting stitches and staples removed would be PAINLESS. Hilliary is the best! I am thankful for her patience, knowledge, and ability to distract me while doing so. She's answered countless questions, and covered all of my concerns. I just wish that Dr. Feagin took "after" pictures, and scheduled me a 6-8 week check-up instead of deciding not to see me anymore after my 3 week check-up. Just seemed too early, but he's reassured me to contact his office should any issues arise.

name: Reyna Freeman
text: I am 6 weeks post op from abdominoplasty, flank liposuction, breast augmentation with mastopexy. I chose Dr. Feagin to be my surgeon due to his excellent reputation, many years in practice, previous experience as his patient, and because this was a second abdominoplasty- which could be more challenging and requires expertise to obtain great results. My first abdominoplasty was done in Chicago while I was living there, after having twins. I am extremely happy with these results! Finally, I have a completely flat belly! Also, I was having issues due to my diastasis that are no longer present since my surgery. Like most women who have had a few babies, I used to have a little bladder leakage during coughing, sneezing, or laughing with a full bladder- but not now! Also, no more low back pain and no more heartburn! I had no idea that these problem could be alleviated by having everything put back into place and tightened up, but yay!!! Not only do I look better, but I feel better too. Win- win!!! I highly recommend Dr. Feagin and his staff. They are knowledgeable, caring, and do great work!

name: Mallorie Hinson
text: Dr. Owen was spectacular. He gave me exactly what I asked for. I am highly satisfied with the services he provided for me. The staff were very friendly and helpful! I would highly recommend them!!

name: Michael Young
text: Very highly recommend this place for any type of cosmetic procedures. My wife and I was very pleased with the results even though its been only two weeks,also the staff was very friendly and helpful.Thanks a lot Dr.Owens and Ms.Olivia for everything...

name: Vicki Morrison
text: After having a baby and losing almost 100 pounds, I needed some help with the excess skin on my tummy. Dr. Feagin more than helped me! I now have the flattest, hottest tummy there is!

name: Adele Pridgen
text: I couldn't get through the receptionist, Hillary, who was very rude and tried to tell me what my insurance would cover and what they wouldn't. Without a consultation, I'm not sure how a receptionist can tell me what is medically necessary and what isn't. I will NOT go to this surgeon because if thier receptionist is this rude I can't imagine what the rest of the staff is like. I'm very disappointed as I know Dr. Feagin has a wonderful reputation.

name: Summer Knight
text: Dr Fegan made my face and neck look so beautiful. I would come back to Dothan for my cosmetic procedures.

name: marqueta mitchell
text:
The best Dr... Alive he loves😍😍 and care about you
And his work is amazing!!! 2 year tummy tuck and fat transfer to my butt.... I'm loving it!!!! 👙👙👙

name: Dawn Bailey
text:
Dr Owen which I heard such raving reviews about disappointed me so much. He put deep grooves in my hips and called it my waist. My pants automatically roll down to this groove. I’m constantly having to pull my pants up. I asked him about it and he swore that was my waist. Lol, you can’t talk to him. He’s always right!! Also my upper muscles are separated again. My upper abdomen has protruded further than my lower ever since he performed my full tummy tuck. An improvement from
before but I still despise the way I look.
The women in the office are mean. He also treated my sister really mean. Dr Dinkle needs to stop harassing me on the phone.

name: Tasharah Cummings
text: Dr Owens and staff are spectacular!!! I had a wonderful experience and my results are perfect!!! I would highly recommend them!!!

name: Abbie Pierce
text: Botox buyers beware!!! I wanted Botox to help with my forehead wrinkles, and was fairly apprehensive since this would be my first time trying it. I was mostly concerned about getting too much injected so as to give me a "droopy" eye, and brought this specific concern up to Dr Feagin beforehand. He assured me that he knew how to administer the drug so that wouldn't happen, and I went forward with the procedure. I now have a droopy right eye. The skin under my brow is completely sagging over my eyelid and it is both uncomfortable and unsightly. I am waiting on a call back to see if there is anything he can do to fix it, but from what I've read, I just have to wait till it wears off.

name: Whitney Geohagan
text: Friendly staff and I am always satisfied with my results!

name: Tori Fleahman
text: I never had the chance to meet Dr Feagin and Owen, however I can say that their staff is appalling. I cancelled my consultation after speaking with Jennifer over the phone. Such a rude and hateful attitude, there is absolutely NO way I would be giving my money to a practice that cannot treat their future patients kindly.

name: Libba Hartzog
text: Very happy with face, neck, and brow work. Highly recommend their work!

name: Veronica Armstrong
text: I recently had a belt lipectomy (June2016) I did a lot of research on who I wanted to perform this life changing surgery over the past year prior. I chose Dr Owen from Feagin & Owen in Dothan AL. Almost every person I approached that wore scrubs from a hospital highly recommended Dr Owen is the person I wanted. I made the consult appt and found Dr Owen to be very professional. He always expressed any concerns or question about my surgery I could contact him any time. A little back ground on myself 10 yrs ago I had gastric bypass surgery after weighing in at 350 lb. I have thought about this surgery for the past 3 yrs. I lost a total of 150lb and slowly crept 35 lb thru the yrs. My idea weight I wanted to achieve is 200. I'm 5-11. After removing 16 lb hanging off my body I came out of surgery weighting 219. Today i'm 213 and going to reach my goal with my new found inspiration of this new body. I went from a Lane Bryant 20 to a 16. I'm amazed every time I actually look at myself now at the work Dr Owens has performed as it was a struggle removing 16lbs. I plan on doing a small revision after a year just to perfect the final touches. I would highly recommend Dr Owen if you are planing this body transforming surgery. He never made me feel embarrassed or ashamed when I had to reveal the part of myself I was most embarrassed by. He is truly a professional and only looked at my issue as the best way to achieve the best results for me. Thank you Dr. Owen for being on top of your game and truly want the best for your patients.

name: LaJuanna Walker
text: If you are black and overweight don't go see the bald guy. He has a God complex and he is very nasty towards you. Tries to belittle you and make you feel like your questions are not legitimate. He is very biased and he will not even touch you. I have been to him 2-3 times at the request of my doctors for a breast reduction. He told me I should just go chop them off. Who tells a woman that kind of thing when they come to you for help???? I implore all women of color to stay away from him because mentally he is jacked up.

name: Reagan Chaney
text: I got a breast reduction in December 2015 and I think Dr Owen did a wonderful job!

name: Anna C

name: Sharon Laurent
text: Dr.  Feagin is very nice and easy to talk too. If I had any questions he didn't mind answering them I highly recommend this doctor.

name: Casey Humphrey
text: Results were EXACTLY what I asked for! Couldn't be more please! Thank you Dr. Owen and staff!!

name: Vanessa Ayala

name: Rachael
text: Love Dr Feagin!!!

name: judy bryte
text: Highly recommend...

name: Q Dee
text: Consultation went well

name: Stephen Churchill
text: Waited 45 minutes to get into an exam room after my appointment time. Then waited for another 30 minutes and counting for the doctor to see me. Do they care about this ? Are they overbooking ? As a patient, if I can call myself one, I feel like they must not care about me. Whenever I get finished here, I now have to deal with rush hour traffic. Going to this office is an all day commitment. This simply makes me sick that I chose this doctor. I could go on. I have plenty of time while I wait for the doctor to see me. My goal for tomorrow is to recover from this stress and try to find a new gastroenterologist.

name: Steve
text:
I just got a letter saying they would no longer serve as my "provider". What a joke. I called last week and voluntarily canceled any and all appointments with this rude organization and the fact that they haven't terminated the receptionist for Dr. MOGLOWSKY named COURTNEY. She is so RUDE and Unprofessional and needs to be doing factory work something that doesn't require interacting with the public. I wouldn't go back to this unprofessional so called Digestive center for all the tea in China. Just read all the reviews on Google, Yahoo, Yelp and Facebook. MOST ARE Negative.  There are other gastrointestinal doctors in the area that know how to treat people. Avoid this one like the PLAGUE.
0 stars of it were an option.

name: Terry Reidselth
text: The staff was nice, but the doctor didn't seem to care, like we were taking up his time.he didn't even want to hear what we had to say...

name: Rebecca Mitchell
text: Previously to coming to the Center for Colon & Digestive Disease I had been to 3 different GI's.  The first one did not diagnose my Colitis, which was present, the other two put me on a medication that did not work for me and would not listen when I told them it was not helping.  I made an appointment and saw Dr. Moglowsky.  All he had was information that I gave him and he said he wanted to start over brand new.  I was perfectly happy with that.  He was kind, listened, and explained things in a way that I could understand.  He worked with me to find the best medication and one that my insurance would cover.  I have only been on my medication less than a week, but my symptoms are already subsiding.  To say that I am happy with this clinic would be an understatement!  I believe Dr. Moglowsky may just give me my life back.

text: They will never call back for any concern you have. Or shall I say, you will wait those 48 hours.  If your pharmacy have a concern for them, it will never get handled.  If they do return the call,  you better sit by the phone because their nurses are REALLY  BUSY and you won't reach them!!!!  I have never seen an unorganized phone system or office as this one.  Dr. Haweri and Dr. Brasco are wonderful doctors,  but their staff is awful.... If you are sick, just go to the hospital because you will get sicker waiting on them.

name: Jeff Franklin
text:
Absolutely the worst patient processing timing ever.
Took mother due to awful pain in back. 2 1/2 hour wait to see doctor Heck. We got there 15 minutes before the scheduled time to be there. I am sure if we missed it they would want to charge for missing schedule. I am totally fed up with doctors that over schedule and then want to charge you if you are late. Not sure if I would go back if doctor recommended him. “Heck” I am not sure if he will show up!

Inexcusable for that type of waiting, especially when it is a back doctor.

name: Andrea F.
text:
Dr Heck saved my life.  Went to the ER at another hospital before seeing him and they thought I was trying to get drugs since I was complaining about back pain.  Dr heck took me seriously and did surgery even though my MRI wasn’t that bad.  Found out during surgery that I had a rare condition with abnormal nerves in my back. He said he sees this condition about every 2 years. The abnormal nerves were causing the pain - I felt like I was being electrocuted.
He also later performed a back surgery on my mother. Her back is much better now.  We were worried about her surviving the surgery due to her health.  She had a rough recovery - but overall her back is much better.  Highly recommend Heck.

resp.text: Amazing story, Andrea! Thank you so much for sharing it with us, and we're thrilled to hear about you and your family's outcomes. We'll make sure your praise is known to Dr. Heck and the whole team.

name: Janice Woodard

Dr. Heck was very nice n very knowledgeable about my concerns. We are going to try an option that has not ever been brought to my attention. I hope n pray it works.

resp.text: Hi, Janice. Thank you for the wonderful review! We're glad you had a great experience.

name: Tasha Ambers
text: Dr. Christopher Heck is absolutely the WORST  orthopedic surgeon in Alabama!  Due to his incompetence, a simple disc herniation has resulted in me being disabled. What should have been a three week recovery has now been more than three years with no recovery!  He performed a second surgery and now I need a third.  After two years, and I decided to let God handle him and not sue him, he got very rude with me and told me he did not want to see me anymore and less I want another surgery. After countless procedures and  thousands of dollars in physical therapy, (22 weeks all together) I will now live with his incompetent error!  He definitely lives up to his name! He’s not worth a HECK!!!!

name: Leigh Pearson
text: Dr. Christopher Heck is so amazing!  He has performed a discectomy for my sister (herniated disc with a conjoined nerve root that he found during surgery, that was causing more pain than just a herniated disc would cause).  She is doing fantastic!  He also performed a fusion from L3/L4 to L5/S1 for my mother who suffers from severe spinal stenosis.  She went from a wheelchair to a walker, and the walker is only because she has neuropathy in both feet!  I cannot say enough about how wonderful this man is!  And he’s not only a smart and talented surgeon, but he’s kind and takes the time to listen to his patients (and their caregivers)!

resp.text: I appreciate the feedback you provided!

name: Angela Thornburg
text:
Dr. Heck is "The DOCTOR" to go see. He is personable, doesn't forget what is going on with you. He explains all procedures in detail with words and explanations that you understand.
With having 3 back surgeries before i was referred by Dr. Lawler from Oxford Alabama. My back kept becoming worse and the pain got to the point I couldnt take it anymore after hurting for about 6 years. Dr. Heck told me that he could help me but i had to have a long and extensive back surgery that was about 5 to 6 hours long. I was ready for anything and I left his office that day confident he would help me.
Dr. Heck came out 3 times during the surgery to speak to my husband to let him know how I was doing, and where he was in the surgery. That meant so much to my husband and me that he had that much consideration not to leave my husband wondering what was going on.
I came out of surgery that day PAINFREE, after 6 years of constant hurting.  I was Up walking around the hospital floor on the second day feeling like wonder woman, I went home on the 3rd day. I can also walk straight and stand straight. That was a bonus that I didn't know that could be fixed.
Everyone from the nurse care in recovery, the nurses there on the floor that took the most gentle and sweet care of me. The sweet people that brought your food, the folks that came to your room to get your food order, to the sweet sweet girls that cleaned my room were a joy to be around. GREAT HOSPITAL!!
Both of Dr Heck's office staff are great and attentive.  They Call You Right Back, friendly, and they get you right in to see him.
I can't say enough great things about Dr. Heck and his staff.  Go see him and get your hurting fixed by a Great Doctor!!! All I can say is Thank God for Dr. Heck because I can't say enough of good about him.
