name: Carl Widrig
text:
I went in to see Dr. Sheppard for a consultation for a minor ailment that I had had for the past 1.5 years. I received a verbal diagnosis for my ailment from Dr. Sheppard consistent with “Stage 1” case (as commonly described, relative to Stage 2,3,4). Dr. Sheppard specifically told me that the ailment was not even a Stage 2 case (commonly tolerated by folks for decades without surgery). He recommended surgical repair in my case, before the ailment got too much worse which could be a “mess” to repair and take longer to recover from. Dr. Sheppard said I had six months to make the decision for surgery. “Prompt” treatment was not needed at the time of this consultation.

(Note: For the new patient consultation mentioned above, the CPT Billing Code that Dr. Sheppard chose to bill to my medical insurance company with was the equivalent of a "Level 5" (the most expensive). The CPT code fitting for the office visit was more like a Level 1 (least expensive).)

A few weeks later I scheduled the ailment surgery … for a date less than two weeks after that.

Two days prior to the surgery, Dr Sheppard made me prepay the full cost of the surgery, consistent with the CPT billing code for a Stage 2 case.

I was not experiencing any symptoms of a “Stage 3” case the morning of date of surgery. My ailment was painless and did not require “prompt” treatment on the date of surgery. If I had been at Stage 3 the morning of the surgery, I would have known. My ailment was a Stage 2 or less case the morning of the surgery.

Just before surgery, Sheppard gave the ailment the quick once-over and said nothing to me to indicate that my ailment was any worse than what he had observed during the consultation a month prior.

After surgery, Sheppard did not indicate to my wife on the phone that the surgery was any more involved than expected. During the call, my wife specifically asked Sheppard on the phone if there had been any “complications” with the surgery. Answer from Dr. Sheppard: No.

At this one-month follow-up appt, Dr. Sheppard did not indicate to me that the surgery had been more involved than expected. In fact, Dr. Sheppard didn’t even talk to me about how the surgery itself had gone - I had to ask him about that as he was quickly walking outside of the exam room after the conclusion of the office visit. He then simply acknowledged that the surgery had gone fine.

A few days after my one-month follow up appt with Dr Sheppard, I first received the bill in the mail. This was the first time I learned that Dr. Sheppard had applied a more expensive, Stage 3 CPT billing code to my surgery, as opposed to the Stage 2 billing code that I had already paid in full against two days prior to surgery.

There is a big difference between a case recently diagnosed as a Stage 1 and prepaid in full as a Stage 2 .. vs. a Stage 3 case that could lead to the death of the patient once it reaches Stage 4 - these two scenarios shouldn’t both be billed with the Stage 3 CPT billing code.

Sheppard is being dishonest to classify my ailment, undetectable-by-patient-and-surgeon-prior-to-surgery as a “Stage 3” case, as an actual, CPT billing code Stage 3 case.  Sheppard should have billed my medical insurance company with the less costly billing code that he had me prepay to a couple days prior to surgery.

Every time Dr Sheppard pulls this stunt on a patient, he pockets an additional $428.

name: Ona Elliott
text: I recently saw Dr. Sheppard for hernia surgery.  He was amazing with helping me understand why the surgery was necessary and what it entailed. The results of this surgery surpassed my greatest aspirations. His followup-care was also wonderful! Thank you doctor for your excellent care, concern AND prayers!

name: Sandy Reeves
text:
Dr. Sheppard Jr., is the "BEST".  After I had a CAT SCAN in January 2016, my family doctor called me, and said, "Find yourself a surgeon".
I have had some serious medical problems since June 2012. The two surgeons who had worked on me back then, said they didn't want to do anything more for me at the time because I was so critical from some previous surgery.
It was a very low point for me, my family doctor didn't offer any advice, except to find a surgeon. The CAT SCAN showed something. ? ? ? That's when I told my husband, I was going to see Dr. Sheppard Jr. He had done a hernia repair on me in 2006, which was just fine. He hadn't seen me for
ten years since the hernia surgery, I felt it was my only chance.
The surgery I had in June 2012, had never really healed. My husband had to pack my wound for FOUR YEARS - Twice a day! "YES" for FOUR YEARS - Twice a day, I was loosing body fluids & blood.
In January 2016, he said something was blocking the wound and insisted I get a CAT SCAN. Something about 8" long was on the scan.
The surgery of June 2012, had cut into some of the mesh from my hernia surgery. Because I was so critical, the surgeon had to close me up.
During 2014 and 2015 I had pneumonia. The hard coughing during that time apparently loosen the last piece of mesh and had migrated to the opening of my wound.
Dr. Sheppard Jr. had review my medical history of 2012 and at my second appointment was able to remove the piece of mesh through the hole of my wound. Within 48 hours, I knew I was starting to heal.
"Thank You" for all your help & God Bless You!

I am comfortable recommending him, even to other secular humanists/atheists.  As far as I can tell, he is a skilled surgeon and does a good job despite his sincerely held belief in a god.  He has earned my respect and gratitude.

name: null hypothesis
text:
Don’t let his youthful appearance fool you.  Dr. Sheppard is a world class robotic surgeon.  He was able to diagnose my medical problem in one office visit and 9 days later, I was being prepped for surgery.
Dr. Sheppard tells you what to expect after surgery and what problems can result from your surgery based on your health status.  It’s scary.  But his calm demeanor is reassuring.  He practices medicine with great compassion and humility.  We prayed together before the surgery which was very comforting.  It was my first surgery and he and his staff, along with the fine staff at Crestwood Medical Center did their best to deliver a successful outcome.  His surgical skills and post-surgical care have restored my health.  I will be forever grateful for the excellent care I have received from Dr. Sheppard and his staff.  I would not hesitate to recommend him to anyone.  God Bless You, Dr. Sheppard.

text: Dr. Sheppard is the most caring, kind, intelligent doctor I have ever had the pleasure of providing my medical care.  He has exceptional bedside manners and he truly cares for his patients.  Dr. Shepphard has performed two surgeries on me and, each time, he made sure he prayed with my husband and me at the hospital, just before going into surgery. His spirit-filled prayers calmed my nerves. I felt an immediate sense of calmness as he prayed, thanking God for His blessings and asking that God guide his hands, as well as the hands of all other medical professionals working alongside him in the surgical room. Thank you, Dr. Shepphard for your outward expression of your recognition of God as the source from whom your expert medical skills are derived. Also, thank you for always taking the time to explain the cause of my ailments, what I can do to have better surgical results and what I should expect after surgery. A huge thank you for encouraging me to loose weight and remain healthy both pre and post surgery. I pray that God will continue to guide you in your profession. He was our light during the darkest time of our life. He also operated on my husband several years ago and he delivered outstanding medical service. He is smart, knowledgeable, always on point, and genuinely caring.

Finally, Dr. Kettunen thanked me for letting him take care of me.  What doctor does that?!? Dr. Kettunen did. The whole process could not have been better, thanks to Dr. Kettunen.

He is sincere and a true professional!  Instead of a group of staff, he took care of me personally every step of the way.  I’d absolutely suggest this doctor to anyone who is nervous about surgery.

name: Dennis Gentle
text: One of the best at diagnosing possible causes of symptoms in one office visit and providing clear, understandable, logical explanations that I have ever encountered.  Outstanding professionalism, bed side manner and common courtesy.  After visiting another doctor for an evaluation of my sons back pain and being told “oh he’s just young and probably strained something. Give it a few weeks and if it doesn’t get better check back with us”, I immediately scheduled an appt for him with Dr Casey.  In one office visit, after doing a thorough evaluation, we were told what she suspected it to be.  A fractured vertebrae.  This was confirmed by subsequent contrast mri.  I have seen Dr Casey myself for a pain that turned out to be something orthopedics don’t treat.  However she had her team forward her evaluation on to my primary care and ordered the additional tests I would need for him to confirm the diagnosis.  So I had the results my primary care needed.  As a result it saved me a visit to my primary care and I received relief quicker as a result.  Which also saved me time off from work and another copay.  And she’s a Birmingham native working for the most prestigious orthopedic center in the area.  One of the best in her field.

name: April Adams
text: Dr. Casey is a very thorough doctor and was willing to get to the bottom of getting rid of my pain. She is smart and has a great bedside manner. And her staff is easy to work with.

name: Toya Williams
text: Only gave one star because it is the lowest I can give. I saw Dr Casey 6 weeks ago with a bad break on my thumb. It covered more than 50% of the joint surface (confirmed by second opinion with a hand specialist). She recommended a thumb cast and told me as long as I didn't mind a bump on my finger it would heal. She told me it was healing at 5 weeks even though the x-ray looked the same as the first. She told me to quit wearing the cast and start to use it. If it wasn't better in 2 weeks I would need to see a surgeon. Well I saw a surgeon today and it is too late to fix my thumb. He put a stack splint on to try and pull the bones together so fibrous tissue can form and help with my pain. I will never have full function of my thumb again, it won't bend all the way due to the break. And I will never be able to use my thumb without pain. It will also get arthritis because it was left untreated. Basically, the 5 weeks I spent under Dr Casey's care was a complete waste of my time. I hope no one else falls into this same situation.

text: I had let my type II diabetes get out of control to the point of unfortunately needing a toe amputation. Dr. Krauss did the procedure after setting up surgery (shunts to improve blood flow through my groin). I was a smoker up until that point. Dr. Krauss was a straight shooter throughout the whole thing. I was fortunate that I didn't loose that foot or even a leg. He emphasized no more smoking.  Sad that it took getting to this point to be ready.  In a nutshell, Dr. Krauss and Dr. Heideprem (vascular surgeon) saved my life and I will be forever grateful to them.

name: Gregory Eagerton
text: I saw Dr. Smith at his Grandview office as a new patient this past Friday.  Excellent experience.  Reception at front desk professional, personable, and efficient. Dr. Smith came to room within five minutes of X-ray completion, examined hand, discussed options for treatment, and decisions made to move forward with surgery.  Surgery scheduler walked in behind Dr. Smith and within minutes my surgical procedure was on the books and the visit was complete.  I am confident I got excellent care by the team, will have a successful procedure this week, and was treated by professionals with the respect and integrity all patients expect.  As a healthcare professional that's been in the "business" for over 30 years, I know quality when i see it and i saw it during this visit!

Xrays have been quick and are completed onsite, as is the therapy/rehab office where they made my splint in only minutes. All the staff from check in, rehab, X-ray, PA, nursing, all the way to Dr Mitch have been just the nicest most caring people. name: Andrew
text:
Dr. Wilson never noticed that my mother had a textbook DVT 5 years ago. I had to personally drive her to the hospital to get a real doctor where they treated her DVT.

For some reason my mother returned to this moron for the past 3 years. He misdiagnosed my mother as having a Baker's cyst on the back of her knee 3 years ago, never followed through, never actually tried to confirm it for the last 3 years. I made her go to USA Mitchell cancer institute because as it turns out she has a tumor, malignant sarcoma, not a Baker's cyst as Dr. Wilson believed. It's grown so large in the 3 years she's seen him that she might lose her leg or worse.

Dr. Wilson is more suited to being a civil war surgeon, sawing off legs left and right than a modern medical doctor.

resp.text: Andrew, we take your feedback seriously because we strive to exceed expectations for all patients. If you'd like to discuss this further, please call our office manager at (251) 476-5050 during regular business hours.

It has not been a walk in the park but at week 4 I was driving. My scar is minimal, but the best, the very best thing is I don’t have that constant pain. Dr. Wilson has given me back my life.

I'm just out of a cast and he is making sure I begin activities very slowly. Slow and steady wins the race!  Could not be happier with how Dr. Rachel has treated me and explained everything along the way.

name: Angie Jeppesen
text:
I have had many surgeries and experiences with doctors... and I have NEVER been treated that well before! From the moment the pre- op nurse came to get me until I was in recovery with the post-op nurse.... EVERYONE I encountered was very friendly, very careful about my allergies, and gave an overall sense that they CARED about me not as a number on a chart, but as a person. The amount of effort everyone put in to making me feel comfortable and not quite so anxious was a welcome surprise. The constant checking of what I was allergic to was also a tremendous shock! Not only were my allergies noted, but they were monitored very carefully... my voice mattered!! I cannot say enough good things about my experience yesterday. This was an amazing team and I am so thankful to ALL of you for the wonderful care you gave me. If only other doctors, nurses, hospitals, teams, could follow your ways of helping people... we would have a much better world in which to live. THANK YOU.... with all my heart, thank you! Best wishes to all of you!
With most sincere gratitude,
Angie Jeppesen

name: Cynthia Johnson
text: Horrible, horrible, horrible experience! Never in my life have I experienced such harsh treatment from a doctor! Even my first visit with him was horrible! As I attempted to explain my situation to Dr. Rachael he gazed at the wall as If I bored him and even when it seemed as if I had his attention he gave off a very nonchalant attitude. My second visit I left crying because he screamed at me so bad as if I was lying and made my injury up just to get paid under workers comp because he ordered a carpal tunnel test that came back positive be he explained to me the Dr. was wrong who performed the test and that half the people in the lobby would come back positive for carpal tunnel even though they don't have it. My thoughts was why would you test me for carpal tunnel which would include the middle finger, the pointer finger and the thumb only when I have clearly from day one told you my pinky finger and ring finger are numb and painful which would be cubital tunnel. So for his mistake I was scolded like a toddler. He then ordered an MRI which came back schowing a tear in my right wrist on my tfc disk and on top of that an ganglion cyst 16mm by 6 mm that has grown inside my inner wrist. When the results came back he canceled my visit and told his staff to inform me that I need to find another doctor to assist me...WOW IS ALL I CAN SAY!!! All that attitude and harsh treatment and didn't have the nerve to face me because you was wrong all along!!! Humble yourself Dr. Rachael!!!!!! PLEASE BEWARE!!!!

name: artgirl
text: Dr Rachel is by far the worse orthopedic surgeon that my husband had the misfortune to use..mike's ring finger was amputated october 2016....he didnot do a culture on the finger and so his hand became infected...so mike was forced by this so called doctor to spend time at the worse hospital in mobile...providence hospital..rachel told us that they had wonderful wound care specialists there and mike would be taken care of...he said that providence was closer and we would be able to see him more...he was wrong on all counts...i would call his office and talk to his nurse to try and get to see infectious disease and wound care because mike had seen neither..i told someone at their office that i was afraid that mike was going to die there...that ...is how bad it got...i was calling the nurse managers everday of the 10 days we were there...i even confronted dr rachel in the cast room and i told him it was his fault that mike was in the hospital because he could have done a culture and got him on antibiotics sooner...he just looked at me blankly and said ok...ok and then told me he heard me and i said i hope so...mike's amputated finger looks like a butt hole...that is what mike thinks...it is horrible looking...poorly done...and the bandaging of the wound caused another wound that we are still dealing with a year later...mike ended up having that pinkie amputated too...having a ray revision...all because of rachel's incompetence... we quit going to him in december 2016...i don't like him and i am a fair person but i donot trust him...if you need a hand surgeon go to Dr Burkett...he is supposely good...but please don't go to rachel...mike passed away on july 24...2018...i blame rachel as the main one of the doctors to cause his demise...the one to start mike's downward slide...i have gone to dr burkett...he is great...too bad mike didnt go to him instead of horrible rachel...

name: Jacinda Haines
text:
I gave this office a call seeking a second opinion about a procedure that my seven-year-old son was scheduled to have. I had some trepidation about the procedure, which was a colonoscopy to check for things like polyps, ect. I wanted to know if a proctologist could examine my son without anesthesia. They were more than helpful.

First of all, the nurse was very helpful in walking me through the steps necessary to book the appointment whether it was a referral, or a second opinion. Then, she began to ask me about the problem that my child was having. To my surprise, she handed the doctor the phone. I immediately felt as if I was being heard by the medical profession,  which is something that we have lost over time.

When the doctor picked up the phone, it was as if my son was already a patient of his. He asked me everything that was going on from the timeline to his symptoms. After listening to me, he assured me that I was on the right track with the colonoscopy.

He had every opportunity to schedule an appointment just because he could, as we were at such a vulnerable state. But he didn’t, and I respect and appreciated that. I can tell that this doctor really cares about his patients, their care, their results, their well-being, and he loves what he does!

If you watch his video, what he says lines up with what he delivered to me over a simple phone call. I can only imagine being his actual patient.

If you are looking for a proctologist, he is highly recommended!

Thank you Dr. Bornstein and you’re nursing staff!

We had my son’s colonoscopy, and everything came back well!

resp.text: Thanks for the great review! We are grateful to be able to deliver compassionate care for all.  Have a wonderful day! -Ascension Providence Community Manager

text: I've recently had a second proceedure with Dr. Joseph Bornstein, and, again, I am extremely grateful and pleased. He explains, in detail, EVERYTHING, and listens to your concerns about your health issues, then plans a strategy for better health. He's dynamic and his overall staff @Providence is amazing & friendly. I'm super happy that I was recommended to him and that he and his staff are really interested in each patient's wellness. name: Chris Bouldin
text: I met Dr. Mailapur when my wife decided to have the gastric sleeve. She wanted us the have the surgery done at the same time, but I was very skeptical of it. I watched my wife do fantastic with it and is still crushing it. That and a health scare is what helped me in making my decision to have the surgery. During this time, Dr. Mailapur was always very supportive and continued to encourage me to consider the surgery for not just me but for my family. I had the gastric sleeve surgery the Friday before Labor Day 2020. I weighted 384lbs on the day of surgery. I had tried many many times on my own to loose weight with me actually weighing at my heaviest 425lbs. The lowest I was ever able to get to was 371lbs but slowly gained it back to my weight before surgery. Since surgery I have lost 80lbs and just finished my first ever 5k this past weekend. I’ve never wanted to run unless something was chasing me or I was running to get in line to eat. Now I run with my family to stay healthy and be around for a long time. I cannot say how thankful I am for Dr. Mailapur for all his help and encouragement.

name: Larry A
text: I have a huge regret about getting the Gastric Sleeve surgery with Dr. Mailapur. My huge remorse is I did not do it years ago because of fear! Being referred by my heart doctor to Dr. Mailapur was an absolutely lifesaving experience.  I had Gastric Sleeve surgery in November of 2020. I am now down over 125 pounds and still losing weight. It was like carrying around over two 60 pound sacks of concrete!  My goal is to lose about 160 pounds. The new way of living and using the tool given to me by Dr. Mailapur has transformed my life. I was taking 225 units of insulin a day. Now I don’t take any insulin! I was taking four 500mg of Metformin a day. Now I don’t take any! I was taking two 20mg blood pressure pills. Now I take one 2.5 mg. I feel SO much healthier. Before my surgery I could not get up off the floor/ground without a chair to help me get back up. It is hard to describe the difference in how much healthier I feel. The energy level, mood, aches and pains are so improved. My family doctor has been encouraging me to have the surgery for years. I was just too scared. BUT, my A1C was climbing, my insulin needs were climbing, heart issues were getting lots worse, and my weight was out of control. I had to get help. My heart doctor recommended I have the surgery and said he would only sign for Dr. Mailapur to be my surgeon. He totally trusted him as a surgeon.  I was also blessed that during my surgery Dr. Mailapur found a rare Cancer in my stomach and removed it ALL. According to the Cancer Doctor (Dr. Mailapur sent me to) in about 48 months I would of had stage 4 stomach cancer. I had a hernia Dr. Mailapur also removed/repaired during my surgery. The first few days were a little tough.  BUT, I left the need and desire to constantly eat in the OR at the hospital. My relationship with food addiction has totally changed.  I was encouraged by several people that had the bariatric sleeve surgery to get the surgery. Each one seemed to want to tell me I needed to do it. One offered to carry me. I now understand why they wanted to share this enormous life change with me. It is such a good positive change and blessing in my life. I, myself, now want to share it with others! You want other to have this exciting progressive change in their lives. Dr. Mailapur and everyone in his office has supported me through this journey. I was truly blessed to have this great compassionate team provide me a tool that has literally saved my life!  Thank you Dr. Mailapur and Amanda! And, Jessica for answering all my email questions!  Thanks to all my doctors and staff that helped me, encouraged me and supported me!

resp.text:

name: Jeremy Holley
text:
I would highly recommend Ravindra Mailapur and his office staff.   Between the information seminars, the appointments, and pre-op nutrition class, they take the time to ensure that potential patients learn about the types of surgeries that are offered and the pros and cons of each.  Additionally, the pre-op nutrition class and follow up appointments in particular do a great job of informing you of the needed dietary, medical, behavioral, and lifestyle changes that are necessary to properly maintain your health.

It's been a year since I underwent surgery with Dr. Mailapur.  The surgery went extremely well and I have had no complications with it.  At this point, I have lost 105 lbs from my highest weight pre-surgery.  I am within five pounds of my goal weight of 175 lbs.   This has been lost due to the combination of the realities of the changes made to my diet and eating habits from surgery and my resumption of an active lifestyle.

Bariatric surgery may not be for everyone, but it is a great tool to help you to either reclaim a level of health that you once may have had or to challenge yourself to make a positive change for the first time.   I am nearly 45 years old, but I feel the best that I've felt since my early 20s.  I run regularly and I've started to take martial arts classes with my kids.   I don't feel as tired any more.  If you do struggle with weight loss, I would encourage you to look contact this office and inform yourself.

name: Christopher Gregory
text:
On November 13,2013 I chose to have gastric bypass surgery. My heaviest weight recorded was 650 lbs. Dr Mailapur and his staff along with the staff of the bariatrics department of Huntsville Hospital were a life saver. I had to lose 200 lbs before my surgery. Since my sleeve surgery I have lost a total of 430 lbs. Dr Mailapur tells every one “ I can only offer the tools in which to lose weight “ you have to use them.
So I never started out being a morbidly obese man. I was and have been heavy for most of my life. In 2003 I suffered a massive herniation of L 3,L4 sciatic nerve damage and drop foot syndrome. In 2003 I weighed 300-325 on average. But due to the herniation, nerve damage and drop foot , I ate. Being a chef by trade I knew how to cook food. I also knew  how to eat.  I had my 7 year check up with Dr. Mailapur this morning and I have achieved 83% weight loss. Anything over 80% is a huge achievement but it is never without the ups and downs. If your just wanting information or you have made the decision to have gastric bypass surgery .... I personally think that Dr. Mailapur and his staff along with Huntsville Hospitals staff will be an excellent choice for your surgical needs.

name: Bronson McLain
text: Dr. Mailapur performed my Gastric Sleeve in March of 2017 and it has been one of the greatest decisions I have ever made!  I struggled with being overweight my whole life, as has most of my family.  I got to the point where I knew enough was enough and I was ready for help.  I went on Google and began doing research on bariatric surgeons in Huntsville and everything that I could find pointed to Dr. Mailapur as being the best!  And from my experience, that is ABSOLUTELY the case!  I have recommended many people to him after my surgery and they have since had theirs done as well, including my wife.  It has changed both of our lives for the better!  Not just physically, but more mentally than anything!  Dr. Mailapur and his staff go above and beyond with you to make sure that you know absolutely everything you need to know before and after your surgery and what you need to do.  It's now been four years since my sleeve and I almost can't remember what it was like to be that guy that first walked into his office at 317 pounds.  In just 9 months after my surgery I lost 125 pounds and have settled at 100 pounds down!  This is what I tell people all the time about having the sleeve done...if you're thinking about it, STOP and just do it!  And, do yourself a favor to see Dr. Mailapur!  The other surgeons in town are great too.  But, none of them go to as much lengths to make sure that you are educated and protected.  Even doing extra tests during surgery to make sure that everything is good!  And, the fact that Dr. Mailapur gets the exact same surgical team every time says something!  He's known as the best and he gets the privileges and respect as being the best.  Dr. Mailapur also removed my gallbladder a couple months ago and it was the easiest surgical experience that I've had; even during COVID.  Trust me!  You can't go wrong with Dr. Mailapur and his staff.  You know it's a good atmosphere when you never see any turnover in the staff!  It's been the same people since I've been going there!  Amber, Jessica, Amanda...all of them awesome!  It's like going to see my friends at every annual checkup!

name: Danielle's Journey Through 30's
text:
So far, so good. The staff is friendly and they get you back super quick.
My husband had a possible hernia so my family physician recommended Dr. Mailapur. Dr Mailapur is very friendly and I feel he tries to listen to his patients concerns and explain things. I do ask a ton of questions and I try to understand everything. Dr Mailapur did ct scans and was very thorough. Turns out, my husband doesn't have a hernia after all! That's amazing news! I, however, have been having pain since I was a teenager from some lumps around my waist and in my hips. These lumps have only gotten larger and more painful as the years have went on. I explained them to Dr Mailapur and he said to make an appointment to see him. I'm so glad I did! He listened to me, carefully and examined me. These tumors (lipomas) are FINALLY coming out! A doctor FINALLY listened to me, about them and understood. 🙌 He explained the quick procedure throughly and the complications that can come with it and I have full faith in Dr Mailapur's medical knowledge.

Update: The surgery went well and I am recovering nicely. A little sore but nothing that wasn't expected. Dr. Mailapur was thourough and removed everything that was bothering me plus sent the lipomas to be tested. I am beyond happy and excited to go back and see him in a few weeks.

resp.text:
Thx Danielle. Wow that is a very thorough and detailed review. Appreciate it very much 😃🙏.

Regards,

Dr. Mailapur

Everyone along the way was kind, patient, and helpful in ensuring that I was comfortable and understanding of all aspects of vertical sleeve gastrectomy.

I had set out with a goal to surround myself by health care providers who were part of my “team” towards a healthier life. Dr. M and his PA, Amanda, we’re just who I needed on my team.

At 27, I am weigh less than I did my senior year of college and I feel so much healthier. I have lost 50+ after surgery 6 months ago and approximately 75 total within the last 8 months. It’s my goal, and theirs, to help me ensure that I never let my health slip from my own fingertips again.

I chose to have Dr. Mailapur do a gastric sleeve after years of battling my weight. Sometimes with some success...but always back where I started with an additional few pounds. It caught up..my blood pressure was rising ...my A1c was rising...i felt bad and had so much trouble with my joints.
The surgery has been 18 months ago. I feel great! I wear clothes that make me feel pretty and confidant. My blood pressure is normal...no more fear of diabetes. Eating habits are changed...in fact..my whole life is better.
Thank you Dr. Mailapur. The program is disciplined...but in a super great way. The staff are wonderful..helpful and friendly and encouraging.

resp.text: Thx for a detailed review. I am amazed at your success. Great use of the TOOL I gave you😃🙏👍🏽

text: My experiences with Dr. Mailapur and Staff have always been positive. Several years ago I initially required his services to remove multiple lipomas. My trust in his abilities led me to have the sleeve gastrectomy (bariatric) procedure about a year and a half ago and I couldn't be more pleased with the results. The decreased number on the scale was a nice reward but my true goal was to feel better and live longer. With the help of Dr. Mailapur and his staff, I'm over 90 lbs lighter, no longer have the need for cholesterol or high blood pressure medications, and reversed my path towards fatty liver disease and diabetes. They have a genuine concern for your continued success through follow-up appointments to discuss topics relative to maintaining a healthy lifestyle. I'm so very grateful for the "tools" I've been given to get my life back on track towards better health.

name: April Shields
text:
Thanks to Dr. Malipur, I am on the path to reset and rediscover myself and my life!! Not only is Dr. Malipur competent and knowledgeable, he's also passionate about his work with his patients.  He's a doctor who truly cares and wants to see his patients succeed.

Upon meeting, Dr. Malipur, he patiently answered all of my questions,  put my fears at ease and assured me that I was making the best decision for my life. After all, what did I really have to lose? I was 5ft 230lb, pre-diabetic, hypertension, asthmatic among other health issues. His team made sure that I was adequately prepared from the first day of consultation up to the very day of surgery.

My VSG was performed on 10/5/2020 without any complications whatsoever.  He also performed a hiatal hernia repair which had previously caused me problems as well. To date, I've lost over 50% of my excess body weight, my asthma symptoms have significantly improved. I normally need my inhaler this time of year but haven't used it since October. My BP is normal, my symptoms of sleep apnea have improved (no daytime sleepiness) and my energy level is consistently up throughout the day.

If you're considering WLS, don't think yourself out of a decision that could potentially save your life. And most importantly, I highly recommend Dr. Malipur for any WLS procedure. - A. Shields

text: I had Gastric Sleeve surgery in 2014 through Dr. Malipar.  I could not be more happy with the results.  I wish I could have done this 20 yrs ago. Almost immediately after the surgery I was able to come off ALL those medications and I have never had a problem with blood pressure or blood sugar since, plus I have lost over 80 lbs and went from a size 20-22 to a size 4-6.  Dr. Malipar is a fantastic physician and really cares about his patients success.  I highly recommend him to anyone considering bariatric surgery.  Thank you Dr. Malipar for this wonderful tool. text:
Dr. Mailapur perfumed surgery on me on March 4th 2013 but his excellent, far above standard, level of care neither started nor ended there. From my first meeting with Dr. Mailapur I felt like it was his goal to help me in the best way possible to ensure long term success as apposed just seeking my money and checking me off the list. Dr. Mailapur is a very quick moving man which was great for getting in and out for visits and checkups, but no matter how fast he was going I never left without understanding everything discussed. I can't seem to remember a time that Dr. Mailapur failed to ask no-less than 3 times if I had any more question. Almost to the level of, "Please ask me questions so I know you understand". I am writing this review as I near my 3 year post-op date and, though my regular visits have ended, anytime that he see me, or even a family member, he ask if things are continuing to go well and offers encouragement or even a "kick in the pants" if needed.

If I were to sum up what an experience with Dr. Mailapur and his office is like it would be: You will leave feeling safe, informed, and cared for!

ENTERED BY AN ANONYMOUS CLIENT WITH ANGELA WRIGHT WRITES

text: I would NOT recommend this physician! I made an appointment to see this doctor for complications I was having after bariatric surgery (more than 45 abdominal obstructions, severe anemia,  & 4 insussuceptions). After being released from Huntsville Hospital I went to see him. He examined me (touched my stomach) for msybe 5 minutes and said there was nothing he could do for me. I was in tears. He didn't care AT ALL. I felt he was a rip off, the office was grossly overbooked, I was charged $150 and had to wait nearly 3 hours to be seen for a few minutes and given no help. I was horrified and felt helpless! Do your research, find a bariatric with more experience and compassion, not just in it for the money. This is a major procedure and should be done by someone who will take care of you before, during, and after. There are better choices!

I sought out Dr. Mailapur because I was extremely disappointed with the manner in which I was treated by one of his peers in the local(Huntsville) area.  YOU OWE IT TO YOURSELF TO COMPARE SURGEONS AND CHOOSE THE RIGHT ONE FOR YOU BEFORE COMMITTING TO THIS SURGERY!

Here are MY reasons that Dr. Mailapur was the right choice for me.
- 0% Fatality Rate (as compared to a 10-12% national average)
- Respected by Dr. Mailapur and his staff (without exception) before, during, and after.
- Dr. Mailapur took the time to explain things to me that others did not.  It was much easier to accomplish the requirements when I understood the reasons behind them.
- Linda Steakley (Nutritionist)
- Absolute Success (I weighed 321lbs. and lost down to 199lbs.)  3 1/2 years later I weigh 202.  All of my chronic conditions, (Diabetes, Gout, Sleep Apnea, High Cholesterol, to name a few) are either gone all together, or controlled.
- I am able to do physical and mental tasks I haven't been able to accomplish in over 30 years.

I strongly urge you to make an appointment to see Dr. Mailapur TODAY.  It will change your life forever.

Dave Treshansky

name: donna youngblood
text: I was having unbearable pain in my shoulder. I had been to a local ER on a Sunday and had been told to see an orthopedic. Monday was a holiday so I called that hospitals ortho office Tuesday morning. They could not see me until the following Monday. I couldn’t wait that long so I decided to try Andrews Sports Med. They got me into the office the next day.  I saw Dr. Rachel Henderson. She was excellent! They took X-rays and did an MRI that same day. The office called me will the MRI results later that same day! Then the next morning, the outpatient office called me to schedule a nerve block which I had the next day! All this happened within 3 days of calling their office! I have never had to see an orthopedic doc before nor have ever had a nerve block so I was nervous. I can’t say enough about everyone I encountered at the offices. If this happens again I will not be nervous. I highly recommend Andrews Sports Medicine. I’ll never go anywhere else.

text: Beware if you are trying to get a visit with Dr Charles Carnell. My 80 year old father,  a recent cancer survivor, had 2 knee replacements at Andrews that went beautifully. His surgeon recognized some issues with his back and recommended a block be administered by Carnell.  Well.. we are now 3 weeks down the road and he has yet to schedule the block and I just found out that it will be another 9 days before he can see him.   No thank you.. we will find another  doctor. My father has fallen twice in the last 3 weeks because of the pain and the fact that Carnell’s office hasn’t even called to update us is unacceptable.

name: William Somar
text: Reputable surgery center but I felt like a number. Visited at the recommendation of my physical therapist for a shoulder issue. When I got to the lobby I could tell this place is set up for mass production: there were check-in kiosks like at the airport and a bunch of people waiting. When I was called the first time, it was to pay. When I was called the second time, I was led to a second  waiting room with no explanation. The third time I was led to an x-ray room where I found out I was getting x-rays. Surprise! Eventually, I was led to an examination room. No vitals were taken. I waited. Eventually, a doctor - not the one I had the appointment with - showed up and immediately started to discuss scheduling surgery without examination. He discussed two procedures - the second one was news to me. When I inquired, he then tested my range of motion to confirm what he had seen in the tests. I expressed doubts about the second procedure and he left to get the originally-scheduled doctor. After nearly 30 minutes, they both came back. The second (scheduled) doctor explained why he recommended the second procedure as a preemptive option. He did a good job of explaining the surgery and recovery. He left and the first doctor took me to a scheduler. Everyone I interacted with was cordial and professional. I never saw my x-rays nor the MRI I had brought with me. I realize this place is good and they have a lot of people to get to. I known they are all fine surgeons. But still, I felt like one more item to check off on their to-do list. I still have unanswered  questions and it is ironic that being there for 2.5 hours and waiting most of the time, that I felt rushed when it came to the consultation. In summary, one of the best places for surgery, but don't expect "the personal touch."

resp.text: Thank you for your candid response. We’re so sorry that this was the case. Your experience was not consistent with the type of care we aim to provide for our patients. Please feel free to call us at (205) 581-7128 if you would like to discuss.

They were surgical, had no problems at all, and are as good as new now.  I have also seen the non-surgical doctors and they are great as well.  They know what they are doing, and do it better than any other doctor.  One family member went to an orthopaedic doctor here in Tuscaloosa several times for a problem with her foot.  He had no idea what was wrong or how to treat her, but he did give her steroid injections a couple of times hoping that would help the problem - it didn't help.  We told her to go to Andrews!  She was able to get a new patient appointment within several days, the doctor saw her, knew exactly what the problem was, performed surgery, and she never had any problems with her foot again.  My family and I highly recommend Andrews Sports Medicine and Orthopaedic Center!

If I could give it a negative star, I would. My wife went to Dr. Henderson for 10 out of 10 pain in her right foot, unable to sleep due to pain and inability to walk on it. After a two hour wait, she was seen, by Dr. Henderson, which was weird because appointments were available all day?  She was condescending, said pain is being caused by a callous on the bottom of her foot and that a pumice stone would take care of it. Then my wife proceeded to take off her other shoe and stated " why isn't the callous hurting this foot." Dr. then said, well, maybe it is a bunion. No X-ray, no nothing.

Fast forward two days later, we are getting an X-ray and getting a second opinion. Come to find out it is a severe impact injury with bone growth (Spur) and needs surgery to remove. Dr. we obtained a second opinion from stated he makes his living off of people coming to him from Andrews with misdiagnosis or lack of adequate care.

name: John Pointon
text: I chose Andrews for total hip replacement a year ago after research online and personal recommendations from prior patients. I couldn't be more satisfied. The surgeon took time to explain pros/cons and expectations clearly, and answer questions. Back on my feet in no time. Follow up during the year has been excellent and the procedure was transformative. Recently hiked extensive distances over rough, hilly terrain with no discomfort - fantastic!

name: Tom Jenkyn
text:
As a disabled vet, I've had more than my fair share of orthopedic problems and surgeries. I had the good fortune to have Dr Steven R. Nichols perform multiple surgeries on my spine. Yes, they were different problems at different locations. He was recommended to me by friends in Sports Medicine at the University where I worked.

The first was a neck fusion, about 10 years ago. I was without pain, discharged, and went home the same day. Ten days after surgery I drove non-stop from Meridian, Mississippi to San Antonio, Texas. Last July he performed Lumbar Laminectomy surgery and removed the debris and spurs that were causing numbness in both legs and prohibited me from standing up straight. Again, discharged the same day, feeling returned to both legs and walking as the Good Lord intended.  There is not another Doctor on the planet I would allow to cut on my spine than Dr. Nichols.

His professionalism exemplifies what Andrews Sports Medicine stands for.  My family and I were always given  the same care and concern as the professional athletes they have become famous for treating. Simple logic dictates that if world class professional athletes with unlimited resources, who depend on their bodies performing at the level they do, seek out his services, it must be top notch. I have recommended him to friends and will continue to do so. If I didn't recommend him, it would be as though I didn't care about people who are an important part of my life.

name: Amy Armstrong
text: Andrews Sports Medicine and Orthopaedics Center is a very busy place but it is run like a well oiled machine. I’ve never had to sit in the waiting room more than a few short minutes. Several friends recommended Dr. Sam Goldstein to me and I wasn’t disappointed.  Dr. Goldstein listened to me patiently, had my MRI done on the spot and gave me results that same day. My injury is still healing but I’m getting there.

resp.text: Amy, thanks so much for the 5-star rating and for the kind words about Dr. Sam Goldstein.

name: Christine Boyce
text: We came to Dr. Dugas from Cleveland, Ohio because of my 14 year old son's elbow pain when playing baseball.  We went to several doctors locally and were never given a real diagnosis or an effective treatment plan.  Dr. Dugas really took the time with us.  He told us exactly what was wrong and his treatment plan worked like a charm.  I am so grateful for his help.  It was so worth the extra time and money to travel to him.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, and for taking the time to share your experience.

name: Michael Zelenak
text: Dr. Flanagan at Andrews did my hip replacement. Highly recommended. One year later and I am back running 10k's.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, and for taking the time to share your experience.

name: Laura Miller
text: I couldn’t have asked for a better staff that was very efficient and professional even their surgical staff was just as good....Thank you all at Andrews Sports Medicine and Orthopedic.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words and for taking the time to share your experience.

name: Rick Johnson
text: Andrews Sports Medicine is a fantastic resource if you' are suffering from any type of injury from being an athlete or just an active adult.  I saw Dr. Dugas and his surgical procedure was spot on;  before long I will be back doing what I like to do.  Lifting heavy things!!  Thank you Dr. Dugas and Andrews Sports Medicine!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, and for taking the time to share your experience.

name: Deborah Rodda
text: My surgery went very well. All of the nurses were very good. Dr Cordover was the best.

resp.text: We’re so glad you had a great experience!

name: Mixti Cox
text: Do Not go to Samuel Goldstein.  He did a total knee that became infected during surgery and he refused to see me about it because my insurance had changed.  Thanks to him the infection nearly killed me and I had to have my leg amputated above the knee.  He also hung up on me when I politely tried to discuss the matter with him.  He is downright mean.  He does not care about his patients, only the money he can make from them.  It’s too late for me but please save yourself.

resp.text: Ms. Cox, we appreciate your feedback and regret you feel like you had a negative experience.

name: Jake Slick
text: Great staff. Very knowledgeable and friendly.

resp.text: We’re so glad you had a great experience!

name: Heather Battles
text: Dr. Dugas was phenomenal with my daughter!  She felt comfortable with him bc she felt like he cared and understood exactly what she was telling him about her pain.  He operated on her shoulder and she is back doing what she loves....cheering!  Thank you Dr. Dugas and all your staff for being amazing!!!!

resp.text: Heather, thank you so much for trusting in Dr. Dugas and his team as well as taking the time to share/rate your family's experience.

name: Henry Mullinax
text: Excellent Professional care, staff is concerned in a path to wellness recimmending surgery after all paths to healing are explored. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Henry, thank you for the 5-star rating and for trusting in our team of doctors!

name: A R
text: I have had to go several times to Andrews Sports Medicine because of overuse injuries and also from my own clumsiness while working out. Every time, it has been a good experience. From the front desk to the X-ray techs to the PA’s and, of course, the doctors, every one took the time to make sure my issues were taken care of. I would recommend this practice and these physicians over and over again with no hesitation!!!!

name: Steven Smith
text: Awesome as usual- efficient

resp.text: Thanks for the positive feedback!

resp.text: Thanks for the positive feedback!

text: I called to get an appointment took over 24 hr to call me back I have had many knee surgeries this time I felt like I was getting the run around the doctor who has seen me in the past did not want to see me and when I ask question I was told they could not see me now due not having old recorder from 32 yr ago.  the young lady on the phone was pleasant but the service and caring was not there.

text: I had a spinal fusion in 2016 and partial knee replacements in 2017/2018 Dr. Cordover  and Dr. Moore and there staff were awesome.  I would highly recommend both Dr. Cordover and Dr. Moore.

text: As a medical professional myself, it was impressive to see how well organized the team and processes are at the Clinic.  Excellent service and rapport!

resp.text: Thanks for the positive feedback!

name: Margaret Millsaps
text: My husband had Knee Replacement Surgery at Andrews Sports Medicine last Week. The care he received was Absolutely Fantastic. I’ve always heard wonderful things about this facility…it is very easy for me to understand why professional athletes come from all over the country to have there Surgery here...not to mention famous stars from Hollywood. Dr McGough is a Great Surgeon and I am so thankful for his Skillful Hands...his Kindness and Compassion to us was Truly Amazing! My husband liked him from his first visit and immediately felt he was in the right place with a great doctor and no longer was dreading his surgery. I was overjoyed because I’ve been seeing the pain in his eyes and the depression sinking him lower and lower for several years. I’m feeling Blessed and grateful for our choice of Andrews Sport Medicine. Margaret Millsaps

resp.text: Mrs. Millsaps, thank you so much for trusting in Dr. McGough and for the kind words.

name: Kevin sellers
text: Dr. Cordover and Dr. Bullock performed an anterior L5-S1 fusion with the Medtronic LT cage device on February 4, 2019. The surgery was a success. Dr. Cordover and his staff was most professional and friendly . I would like to also recognize all the staff at Andrews Sports Medicine and Orthopedic Center and the staff in St. Vincent's hospital for the high quality of care I received while I was there post surgery. Thank you Dr. Cordover and all who assisted in my surgery and post op care.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review! We’re so glad you had a great experience!

name: Sean McKim
text:
Great set of doctors. My son had knee issues that was misdiagnosed for over a year. After 1 visit Dr. McGough diagnosed the problem and scheduled surgery. It's been 7 months since the surgery and he has not had a single problem with his knee.
I have several friends and family members that have used Andrews with the same great results. There is a reason athletes from around  the world use this group.
I recommend Andrews to anyone needing a sports/ortho related Dr.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your kind words, Sean. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us.

Thankfully,

Andrews Sports Medicine and Orthopaedic Center - Birmingham, AL

name: Thompson Laura
text:
I will never go back, all I heard was how great these group of doctors were but my experience from trying to get an appointment, to providing my insurance, driving a total of 9 hours, to lastly being treated like I was lying about my condition was a totally different experience for me. I am totally let down and feel like I wasted my time.
I have been dealing with my condition for 3 years and finally took the time to do something about it and this is what happens. I thought I was seeing the best. It seems like they have a lot of clients and I am only one,,, so I'm sure I don't matter to much, but I will not waste my time again and will tell everyone I know to not waste theirs.

text: Simply outstanding from the initial meeting thru the procedure thru the follow ups. Very pleased and highly recommend to one and all.

name: Pepper Pepper
text: I had the best experience anyone have with Dr. Cordover and Dr. McKeon. I originally went  in for my neck pinched nerve in neck. Dr. Cordover was on a mission. I am a bodybuilder/power lifter I have worked out since I was 13 yrs old. Dr. Cordover listened to my complaints and said that he would get us some answers. He noticed that I had atrophy in my hand and immediately contacted Dr. McKeon and they tag teamed me. I required surgery on my arm due to the muscle atrophy. Dr. Cordover wanted to wait and try a nerve block for my neck first. Long story short Dr. Cordover did neck surgery and I feel like a new man. Thanks to Dr. Cordover for giving me back my life. Superb staff and facilities. Will not use any one else. If I have to rate my experience on a 5 star scale I would give them twenty.

name: Bailey Webb
text: I cannot praise Dr. Dugas and his team enough for taking care of my son. My 7 year old had completely torn his PCL, a relatively unheard of injury in a child. I could not find a Dr familiar with this problem in my hometown, so we were referred to Andrews. Dr. Dugas was so kind and put me at ease, I knew my little guy was in great hands! Surgery went well and the Dr is confident he will be back to doing what he loves in no time- soccer! Thank you to the entire staff at Andrews, Saylor is actually looking FORWARD to his post op visits!

text: Dr. Goldstein is the #BEST!! Thank GOD for 2nd opinions! He draw you an illustration and explain what's going on. He's caring and understanding you can tell from the moment you walk in the building!!!

text: I’m a disabled nurse.  They will take Medicare for the elderly but not younger. This is ridiculous. I worked my but off to help people and now that I’m sick I can’t get the best healthcare.

name: Charlie Strength
text: Two weeks ago Dr. Andrew Cordover operated on my neck. He relieved pressure caused by a disc pressing on my spine and he fixed an old plate that I had knocked crooked and he installed a new plate. Pain that I have had for 16 years is now gone. I have been back at work a week standing in the middle of a busy highway directing traffic. He did an awesome job. Now if I could get people to slow down.

No waiting for hours, absolutely the most professional medical center I've ever been to!

Thanks

name: Brookelynne Mathews
text:
My husband had major foot /ankle surgery with Dr.Waldrop. He had all tendons repaired, his heel was moved over, the archilles tendon cut and lengthened!  It has been Over a year of being off work and unable to walk/stand or wear steel toe boots tk return to work . No matter how much we told this man that my husband IS in pain he did NOTHING except a few x-rays that NEVER show anything. It took an MRI and nerve test in the beginning BEFORE surgery to even find the problem. Not once did Dr. Waldrop order a MRI or nerve test!!  We had to insist on a referral to see a Pain management doctor because after two months he felt my husband didn't need pain meds.
The only thing  Dr. Waldrop would say is "Umm, I see". Never did any test after surgery except an X-ray, and we believe that's because he knows my husbands foot is worse after his surgery.
My husbands long term disability with his company has now been stopped due to Dr. Waldrops opinion that he can return to work WHEN HE CANNOT!!!
If you use this man make sure you get in writing from him BEFORE leaving his office if you can't return to work. !!

name: Linda Bagwell
text: Diagnosed with plantar faciatus and given exercises and therapy. Didn't take too long to resolve it.

resp.text: Ms. Bagwell, thank you so much for trusting in our team of doctors and for taking the time to share/rate your experience.

text: They have a wonderful staff Dr Dugas has taken great care of my son

name: Cameron al Shaqar
text: Ridiculously long wait time. There are several more doctors as good as these that won't make people wait so long

resp.text:
Cameron, we apologize for the long wait and inconvenience. We do our best to let all patients know to allow a minimum of two hours for their visit.

We are a high-volume practice. Our physicians are committed to spending adequate time with every patient to listen to their situation, properly diagnose their condition, discuss recommended forms of treatment, and address any additional questions and/or concerns they may have. Unfortunately, this sometimes results in long wait times.

name: Stephanie Jones
text: I was recommended to see Dr. Galloway  by my wife.  I really can't give a any kind of an idea or ability due  to the fact  I  never made it past the office taking my payment.  Two  visits I sat in the waiting area one hour  past my appointment time.  I also work in a professional area, I always keep my appointment times.  Life and limb is understandable, but twice is unacceptable.  Unless you have time to spare or have someone to have conversation with I suggest make your appointment one  hour earlier than you plan to arrive because like me you may not be able to charge your time to BC/BS. I lost money and received no service.  My advice, find another physician.

name: Jason Riemann
text: The absolute best office staff in Mobile AL. Extremely thorough and efficient. Dr. Galloway is precise and really cares about his patients. Would not recommend any other general surgeon in Mobile and I will be referring patients his way in the future.

name: Kimberly Giles
text: Great Experience. .Staff is top notch and so is there customer care and Dr Galloway is the best ..Excellent bed side manner and attentive and listens to patients needs

name: Life in Camo Media, LLC
text: We have used Jackson Surgery Center three times in the last two years and every visit was a positive experience. The staff is friendly, the nurses are kind and knowledgeable about every procedure we were there for. The staff kept the family/driver informed the entire time the patient was there. The billing department was very easy to work with. I was able to get someone on the phone every time I called to get an insurance issue resolved. I would highly recommend Jackson Surgery Center to anyone that needs the type service they offer. I would give them 10 stars if it were possible.

name: Janice Howell
text: I had a great experience with my kind and caring nurses at my pre-surgery and recovery room time. I'd like to thank Cherri, Philanda and Cheryl personally for their great work. They made sure I was comfortable. As for as the surgery, the anesthesiologist and surgeon made sure I was knocked out for the 7 stitches although I didn't choose to be. Doctor was very late so he didn't want to waste any time. Maybe it was for the best but it was definitely not my choice.

name: Russell Marks
text: I was schedule for a colonoscopy on Mar 4th.  I was notified that I had to report to Surgery Center for Covid 19 test prior to having the procedure.  I called the doctor's office to see if I could have it done in Prattville area as I lived North of Prattville and was told to call Jackson Surgery Center, I did and they said that would be fine.  So I got the test and a letter saying  I had a negative result.  Then next day I get a call from JSC saying what I had was not good enough.  I was asked why I didn't get tested at JSC and explained that it was more convient to have it locally.  She stated that she lived south of Montgomery and came to work every day.  This really upset me!  Long story short I had already spent a whole afternoon getting tested and by the time she called had already begun the prep and had to cancel the procedure.  They need to get better people friendly personal    to contact patients and get there act together as far as what is acceptable covid testing.  I had this procedure at the JSC (prior to Covid) and it was a great experience just glad I didn't have contact with this person back then.

resp.text:
Mr. Marks, thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. We apologize for any confusion.  We will address this issue with our staff, the response you received certainly isn't our expectation. For future reference we have Important Covid Information on our website. You can find it here to review our policies.

https://www.jscal.com/blog/covid-19-information/
If you have further issues or questions please contact our director Missy Sallas 334-293-8484

name: Lisa Hudspeth
text: Better check to see what you owe or they will not do the operation.  They never told me the countless times I’ve spoken with them.  They were extremely hateful.  I asked what I needed and they said insurance card and license.  I drove 4.5 hours and they were going to cancel on me!

name: Vernon Hunter
text: We had a wonderful experience here. Very welcoming and professional. The ladies at the front desk were very nice and helpful.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive feedback.  Our team will be really happy to hear you noticed.   Thank you!

name: Rosilind Maxwell
text: I just wanted to tell everyone how much I appreciated you all for being so gracious and concerned about the experience that I had with you all on October 21st. You made an unnerving and uncomfortable situation pleasant and endearing.  Thank you from the bottom of my heart. God bless each and everyone that works in that entire building.

resp.text: We thank you and are very happy to have had a positive impact on your experience.  Thank you for your kind words we will share this with our team.  With sincere appreciation. Take Care!

name: Jason York
text:
We were surprised by having to pay a second co-pay, one for the facility for the doctor. It was explained that this is because the doctor is not affiliated and it is an out patient surgery. However, the doctor's name is listed as part owner, not to mention the fact that we have had out patient surgeries in the past and not had separate co-pays. We will not be using this facility again, as it appears to be using any way possible to take money. We could have refused, but we already had the time scheduled off work, and it's hard to rearrange a surgery. At the very least, they could have let us know this in advance, instead of at the time of the surgery. We will be using the Baptist hospital system from now on.

Update: No, it wasn't really addressed, we were just told that we would have to pay again or reschedule. It's not about the money, it's about letting us know in advance that there are two separate co-pays, which was not done.

resp.text: Hi Jason, we apologize for any miscommunication. Our administrative team is aware of the concern and has addressed this with the patient.  If you need future assistance or have further questions about our billing policies, please contact our Administrator Mr. John Gray 334-293-8484

name: Barbara Sowell
text: Great experience! Wonderful staff. Highly recommend!

name: leo zemke
text: I am glad everyone else had such a fantastic experience at this place but they almost let my step son DIE!  He came in and was scheduled for exploratory surgery to fix SHODDY WORK DONE BY DR CHANDLER during a sinus polyp surgery and my step son began to pour blood from his Sphenopalatine Artery and the office was more worried about getting another three hundred dollar copay out of us than helping my son.  My wife had to scream for help in the office to get nurses and a doctor to get my son and help him.  We were treated shabbily during the whole ordeal.  My step son was bleeding to death and they did not even have the ability to  give him blood at this facility.  They almost killed him!  IT WAS HORRIBLE!  A HORRIBLE ORDEAL!!!!  I should post photos of all the blood.  The clinic manager was not friendly, everyone acted as if they did not know what was going on or what to do.  They had to take my son by ambulance over the the hospital and then the nightmare continued.  The ER doctor threw my son out of the hospital room that he was scheduled to be in.  It was like they tried to kill my son and then they were trying to sweep us under the carpet or out the door.  TO HIDE US AND THE HORRIBLE THINGS THEY DID AND THE WAY THEY ALMOST KILLED MY SON!!!   It was a nightmare!  They were going to give my son a blood transfusion in the ER and sweep us out the door.  MY WIFE HAD TO ENLIST THE HELP OF THE AMBULANCE DRIVERS Who could see that our son was in agony and practically DEAD AT THEIR HANDS!  The ambulance drivers GOD BLESS THEM talked the angry, crazy doctor into keeping our son and putting us in a room for the night.  This was the worst thing that has ever happened to our family.  I would not allow this clinic to operate on a PET COCKROACH if I had one!  PLEASE BEWARE!!!

resp.text: Dear Leo, we sincerely apologize for your experience with the Jackson Surgery Center.  We strive to provide the highest level of care equally to all of our patients.  We appreciate your feedback and are addressing the issues mentioned with our administrative team.  We promise to also forward your concerns to the Jackson Hospital Administration.  Our commitment to protecting patient privacy disallows us to discuss this in an open forum.  Please do not hesitate to contact our administrator John Gray at 334-293-8484

name: Whitney Boutwell
text: Very organized...very clean

resp.text: Thank you Whitney!  We appreciate your observations and are happy to provide healthcare services to you and your loved ones.  I’ll share your comments with our team. Happy Friday!

name: Carol Roberts
text: My husband and I have both been here for minor outpatient procedures. We could not be more impressed with this facility and can enthusiastically recommend it to anyone needing surgery. We both had excellent care while we were there. The nurse even gave me novacaine before placing an IV in my hand (totally unnecessary, but I appreciate the thoughtfulness). I had some questions about anesthesia, and they actually brought the anesthesiologist to me to answer my concerns. After care and instructions were good.

resp.text: Carol we so appreciate your observations.   Thank you for noticing the “little” things we do to make your outpatient experience favorable.  Speedy recovery!  We will check on you soon!

text: My experience with Dr. Craig was outstanding!!!  He was prompt, very courteous, and is a real pro with injections.  I received an injection in each knee.  He is so smooth, I never did feel a thing!

text: Dr. Craig and his staff were very thorough and explained what was going on with my particular problem in great detail. I feel so confident in the care they provide.

text: Until today my review of Dr. Craig was quite positive.  However the day I was I’m affordably detained on my way to my appointment this resulted in me being 10 minutes late, I did however call before my appointment time to tell them I had been delayed. I did not know I needed to get a name of the person I spoke to. By the time I was able to check in because I had to stand in line to use their kiosk to check in I was right at 15 minutes late. I was then told that Dr. Craig had a strict 15 minute no-show rule. This resulted in having to reschedule my appointment after I had driven 20 miles to get here and now I have to return in the morning. I have waited much longer than 15 minutes after my appointment time on occasion and yes I was very irritated when I was told there was no grace available.

text: Friendly environment with knowgeable staff.  Dr Craig took the time to explain to me my spinal issues and suggested certain avenues to help resolve the pain from my spinal arthritis.

name: Patrica Turner
text: I was referred to Dr Craig for a tendon injection which I had yesterday. Waiting and hoping this is going to relieve the pain I have been in for months. He was just so kind in making sure he wasn’t hurting me. The RT working with him was awesome. There was a third person in the room she just stood back and said nothing. Would like to have known what her purpose was. I would recommend Dr Craig in a heartbeat.

name: Debbie Keen
text: Dr. Craig takes the time to make sure I understand the underlying problem and gets to the main objective which is what's causing my pain and this is how we fix it! I appreciate how I I never have to wait long in the treatment room or waiting room! His office is run efficiently! I would highly recommend him!!

name: Ronald Dewberry
text: Office personnel were very efficient and courteous. Dr Craig and nurse practitioner were very concerned and reviewed my case and helped me to make a decision on my treatment!

text: I always have a fantastic experience with Dr. Craig and his staff. They truly care about their patients and it shows. And he has the best bed side manned.

name: Monica Brown
text: Everyone in the office from front to back, check in to check out make me feel I'm most important. Dr. Craig is great.  I highly recommend this office.

name: Melanie Taylor - Coleman
text:
I refer to Dr. Craig as a medical detective. I had seen several physicians that could not figure out what was wrong with me. He discovered that I have a very rare neurological disorder. Without his knowledge and expertise, I could have suffered years with this with no help from the medical community.

My first couple of visits, I wasn’t sure how I felt about him. But I grew to really appreciate not only the physician, but the type of man he is. He tried his best to help me with a nerve block. That did not work for me. He could have done a series of them. But he did not. He knew that wasn’t what was best for me. He is not trying to line his wallet. Dr. Craig recommended another option that he doesn’t perform, nor does Southlake. Despite having to refer me, he is still looped in on the process and making sure I get the care I need. My case is proof, he is going to find what is wrong and do what is best for his patients.

text: Dr. Rousso did my nose about 5 years ago. He absolutely changed my life. The only thing I saw in the mirror was my nose and I hated it. Now I love my nose, and my side profile. I had consults with two other doctors and both of them said that they would do it but they recommended Dr. Rousso because he specializes in faces and noses. They said he would do a much better job than they could have done. I 100% recommend going to Dr. Rousso for anything face related.. because why wouldn't you want someone who specializes in faces to do your face?

name: Patricia Clark
text: I had a face lift (temple cheek neck lift w/endoscopic forehead, upper & lower eyelids, SMAS lips, nasolabial & melolabial folds) 3 months ago with Dr. Daniel Rousso. The care and expertise I received from Dr. Rousso and his team was exceptional.  My results far exceeded all expectations I had prior to surgery, and I am so grateful I made the decision to choose Dr. Rousso.

text: I had the best experience at Dr. Rousso’s office. The staff were so nice, helpful, and thorough with helping me with everything that I needed. Dr. Rousso is the best and I could not be happier with my results!

text: Had a wonderful experience at Dr. Rousso’s office with Dr. Adams. The staff were friendly and efficient and I felt very comfortable in the clean and welcoming environment. Highly recommend!

When choosing a surgeon trust is vital.
Dr Rousso   is an impeccable Surgeon. I highly recommended Dr. Rousso,  he and his staff are extremely knowledgeable and make it   comfortable to  communicate  with .

text: Dr. Rousso is an excellent physician and plastic surgeon.  He does more than cosmetic work.  Don't let an ENT do surgery on your nose.  Go to Dr. Rousso for any kind of nose or face surgery.  Your insurance will pay Dr. Rousso for any kind of surgery that your ENT would do.

text: Dr. Rousso does a fabulous job with my Botox. He injects along my hairline to ensure that my brows don't drop. He is a true expert with faces, and I will only trust Dr. Rousso with my Botox and any other facial procedures.
